column1: CHICAGO -- — Kris Bryant and Willson Contreras each homered twice
column2: and the Chicago Cubs beat the Braves 13 - 4 Saturday on an afternoon when Atlanta returned Sean Kazmar Jr. to the major leagues for the first time in 13 years . 	 Javier Báez and David Bote also homered for the Cubs
column3: who stopped a two - game losing streak . Chicago entered hitting a major league - worst .166 and then took an 11 - 0 lead in the fifth . 	 “ It 's a collective sigh of relief
column4: ” Bryant said . 	 Atlanta selected the contract of Kazmar
column6: from its alternate training site before the game . He pinch hit in the fifth inning and grounded into a 4 - 6 - 3 double play . 	 Kazmar had not played in the major leagues since Sept. 23
column8: with the San Diego Padres — a span of 12 years
column10: 25 days . 	 “ Obviously was n’t the outcome we were looking for . A win would have been nice
column11: ” he said . “ But what a good feeling . " 	 He appeared in 19 games that season for his only previous major league action
column12: and had since played in Triple - A for the Padres
column15: plus Double - A for the Mets — a total of 1
column16: 106 minor league games . 	 Kazmar was at home living on unemployment insurance last year during the COVID-19 - shortened season
column17: when the minor leagues were called . 	 “ There could have been obvious times where I doubted that this opportunity would ever come
column18: ” he said . “ Honestly
column19: it never really left my mind
column20: especially the last few years that I ’ve been playing in Gwinnett I still felt like I had the ability to play at this level . Just super fortunate to get this opportunity — one to do it with an Atlanta Braves uniform on and secondly to do it at Wrigley Field is amazing . ” 	 The gap between big league appearances was the greatest since that of right - hander Ralph Winegarner
column21: according to Elias Sports Bureau . Winegarner played on June 23
column23: for the Cleveland Indians and did not return to the majors until July 7
column25: with the St. Louis Browns — a span of 13 years and 14 days . 	 Trevor Williams ( 2 - 1 ) allowed one run and four hits in five innings . He had given up five runs and 10 hits against Pittsburgh in his previous start . 	 Hector Ynoa ( 0 - 1 ) gave up six runs and seven hits — including three homers — in four innings . 	 Contreras hit solo shots in the first and third innings off Ynoa
column26: and Bryant hit two - run drives against Jesse Biddle in the fifth and Jacob Webb in the sixth . 	 Contreras has homered in three consecutive games for the first time in his career . 	 “ That ’s what we feel like this lineup is capable of any given night
column27: ” Cubs manager David Ross said . 	 Báez hit a three - run homer off Ynoa in the third and Bote against Webb in the fifth . 	 “ That ’s still a really good lineup
column28: ” Braves manager Brian Snitker said . “ It ’s not hitting on all cylinders early . We ’re not either
column29: quite honestly . ” 	 Ehire Adrianza and Ronald Acuña Jr. had two hits apiece for the Braves
column30: who have lost five out of seven . Adrianza tripled and scored on a sacrifice fly before Marcell Ozuna hit a two - run single in a three - run seventh . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Braves : RHP Bryse Wilson was recalled from the alternate training site
column31: LHP Sean Newcomb ( no reason given ) and OF Ender Inciarte ( strained left hamstring ) went on the 10 - day injured list before Saturday ’s game . ... INF Ozzie Albies is sore and day to day after being hit by a pitch on a calf Friday
column32: Snitker said . 	 Cubs : RHPs Dan Winkler and Brandon Workman were activated from the COVID-19 - related injured list . ... RHP Pedro Strop was returned to the team ’s alternate site in South Bend
column33: Indiana . ... LHP Justin Steele was optioned to the alternate site . 	 UP NEXT 	 RHP Kyle Hendricks ( 0 - 1
column34: 3.00 ERA ) is expected to start Sunday for the Cubs and Wilson ( 1 - 0
column35: 4.02 ) for the Braves . Hendricks was scratched from his start Tuesday because he felt ill . He tested negative for COVID-19 . 	 ------ 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: BOSTON -- — Wearing their new blue - and - yellow uniforms
column2: the Boston Red Sox beat the Chicago White Sox 7 - 4 Saturday when Marwin Gonzalez homered to key a four - run rally in the eighth inning . 	 The uniforms — lacking any red — honor the Boston Marathon with the colors that stretch across the finish line of the famous race . They featured yellow tops with powder - blue lettering across the front
column3: numbers on the back and caps
column4: with white pants . 	 Boston was the first of seven big league teams that will don a new City Series look this season
column5: and will wear them this weekend . The Marathon
column6: usually held on Patriots ’ Day in conjunction with an 11 a.m. start for the Red Sox at Fenway Park
column7: was moved to Oct. 11 due to the pandemic . 	 Xander Bogaerts and Kiké Hernández each had a double and three singles for the Red Sox . Bogaerts ’ double drove in two runs in the eighth that carried Boston to its 10th win in 11 games . 	 “ Baseball is fun again
column8: ” Red Sox manager Alex Cora said . “ Baseball is fun in Fenway . I do n't know how many people we had in there
column9: but it was loud . ” 	 Gonzalez homered into Boston ’s bullpen off Cody Heuer ( 1 - 1 ) . J.D. Martinez drew a bases - loaded walk off reliever José Ruiz before Bogaerts ’ ground - rule hit dropped in down the right - field line before bouncing into the stands . 	 “ This is a pretty good team
column11: ” Gonzalez said . 	 Chicago right fielder Adam Eaton robbed Rafael Devers of a homer when he made a leaping grab before crashing into the wall and hit an RBI double . José Abreu added an RBI double and two hits . 	 “ I think he 's been one of the guys that 's been most consistent
column12: ” White Sox manager Tony La Russa said of Eaton . “ He made a great play . ” 	 The White Sox ( 6 - 8) have lost four of their last six 	 “ I guess at this point in the season we 're not going to freak out about the record and why we 're losing games and why we 're under .500
column13: ” catcher Zack Collins said . 	 Adam Ottavino ( 2 - 1 ) struck out all three batters he faced for the victory . 	 Friday night ’s series opener was postponed due to snow and rain . It ’s scheduled as the nightcap of a split admission doubleheader on Sunday . 	 SHORT WORK 	 Each starter was gone before five innings . Boston ’s Nick Pivetta went just 3 2/3
column14: allowing two runs on four hits . Chicago ’s Dylan Cease lasted a bit longer
column15: giving up two runs and six hits over 4 2/3 . 	 FOND MEMORIES 	 Cora enjoyed reflecting before the game about La Russa
column16: who worked with him as a special assistant for Red Sox President Dave Dombrowski . 	 “ He meant so much in 2018 and ’ 19 . It was always cool to go out to dinner … just listening to those guys talking about their experiences
column17: ” Cora said . “ ( La Russa ) would always leave me a letter after each homestand that I could read on the plane — the things that we could do better . That ’s the way he put it . ” 	 NOT HERE 	 Lefty Carlos Rodón
column18: who threw a no - hitter in his previous start on Wednesday
column19: was originally slated to start Monday morning ’s Patriots ’ Day game
column20: but the team lists righty Lucas Giolito ( 1 - 0
column21: 2.55 ) with everyone getting pushed back because Friday ’s game was called . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 White Sox : Cease was reinstated off the IL ( precautionary reasons ) after a series of negative tests for COVID-19 . … Moncada walked around gingerly after hustling to third and diving back on Abreu ’s double but stayed in the game . 	 Red Sox : Cora said he planned to give Bogaerts Friday off
column22: but with the postponement he was in the lineup . 	 UP NEXT 	 White Sox : LHP Dallas Keuchel ( 0 - 0
column23: 6.43 ERA ) is set to start the opener of Sunday ’s doubleheader . 	 Red Sox : Cora said RHP Tanner Houck ( 0 - 1
column25: and LHP Martín Pérez ( 0 - 0

column1: PHILADELPHIA -- — Yadier Molina hit two home runs
column2: doubled and drove in four runs
column3: and Nolan Arenado and Paul DeJong also homered in the St. Louis Cardinals ’ 9 - 4 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies on Saturday . 	 St. Louis won for just the second time in its last seven games while finding offense that had been missing in the defeats . The Cardinals averaged 2.6 runs in their last five losses . 	 Cardinals manager Mike Shildt pointed to the Cardinals ’ ranking high in two important hitting categories prior to the contest
column4: citing the fact they entered Saturday No . 1 in the league in hard - hit percentage and fourth in exit velocity as proof that positive results were forthcoming . 	 And he was right . 	 “ The proof is in the results today
column5: ” he said . “ We 'll be very confident when our process is positive . ” 	 Rhys Hoskins had three hits and Alec Bohm drove in two runs for the Phillies
column6: who played without Bryce Harper . The Phillies star outfielder sat out after waking up Saturday with tightness in his lower back . 	 Harper said after Friday ’s 9 - 2 win over the Cardinals that he hoped the Phillies could build some offensive momentum on that performance . But it was St. Louis whose hitters got their bats going . 	 St. Louis broke the game open with six runs in the third off Matt Moore ( 0 - 1 ) . Moore recorded consecutive outs to start the frame before a two - out barrage . 	 Molina drove an 82 mph changeup over the wall in left for a three - run homer that made it 3 - 1 . 	 “ He ’s looking to do damage
column7: ” Shildt said . “ He ’s putting good swings on it . ” 	 DeJong followed with a solo shot to straightaway center
column8: and it was 5 - 1 after Dylan Carlson ’s RBI double . 	 Manager Joe Girardi saw enough when Moore ’s first pitch to Cardinals starter Kwang Hyun Kim missed the strike zone . Philadelphia then compounded its problems when another runner reached on third baseman Bohm ’s throwing error on Kim ’s grounder . 	 “ Today we did not play well
column10: but we have a chance to win the series
column11: ” Girardi said . 	 Philadelphia got a pair of runs back in the bottom of the frame
column12: but the Cardinals answered with three more in the fourth on Arenado ’s two - run homer and Molina ’s second of the contest
column13: a drive to deep left that made it 9 - 3 . It was the eighth career multihomer game for the 38 - year - old veteran and nine - time All - Star . 	 “ He 's a multigenerational talent
column14: ” Shildt said . 	 As productive as the Cardinals were
column15: they left some runs on the field . St. Louis loaded the bases with no outs in the sixth but did n’t score . Carlson struck out and Justin Williams grounded into a 1 - 2 - 3 double play . 	 Kim made his first start after being sidelined by back tightness at the season 's start . The left - hander had a promising debut with the Cardinals in 2020 with a 1.62 ERA in eight games
column16: seven of which were starts . He was n’t as stingy against the Phillies
column17: giving up three runs and five hits with four strikeouts and a walk in three innings
column18: but the Cardinals did n’t need him to be . 	 Ryan Helsley ( 1 - 0 ) allowed a run in 1 2/3 innings of relief to earn the victory . 	 Moore
column19: an offseason free - agent signee who pitched in Japan last season
column20: continued his early season struggles . His ERA rose to 10.64 in three starts after surrendering five earned runs and four hits with five walks in 2 2/3 innings . 	 TRUST THE PROCESS 	 Shildt talked in depth about the club ’s hitting before the contest
column21: saying he was encouraged by the process if not the results . 	 “ We wo n’t excuse results
column22: we know results and expectations are high
column23: ” he said . “ But the challenge of this wonderful game that we play and we enjoy that can also be maddening at times is you can do a lot of things right and not get rewarded . … Sometimes you ’ve got to let it roll a little bit . It ’s not about an alibi
column24: but we can be fact - driven and process driven . ” 	 STILL STREAKING 	 St. Louis ’ Tommy Edman extended his hitting streak to 12 straight games with an infield single in the fifth . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Phillies : Harper was bothered by a back injury at the end of last season that affected his throwing . He may have been injured Friday when he drove two balls to the warning track and doubled with a headfirst slide into second . 	 “ He was stiff today
column25: ” Girardi said . “ We just think it ’s day to day . I do n’t want to put him in a situation where he goes out and plays and it gets worse . We ’ve got a long season . ” 	 Girardi lifted Jean Segura in the sixth inning because the second baseman had an upset stomach . 	 UP NEXT 	 Cardinals RHP John Gant ( 0 - 1

column15: Cole Irvin ( 1 - 2 ) struck out six

column1: Josh Naylor lined into a triple play in the eighth inning
column2: then let a routine grounder roll through his legs at first base with two outs in the ninth that led to Cincinnati 's tying run as the Reds beat the Cleveland Indians 3 - 2 in the 10th Saturday . 	 Pinch - hitter Tyler Stephenson 's single in the 10th won it . 	 Naylor had a chance to boost Cleveland 's one - run lead in the eighth when he came up with runners at the corners with no outs . He hit a liner to first baseman Joey Votto
column3: who tagged Franmil Reyes as he tried to dive back into the bag and then threw to third to double off Eddie Rosario
column4: who took off because he thought the ball hit the ground and had already crossed the plate . 	 “ We got the break and we made the most of it
column5: and we came back and won
column6: ” Reds manager David Bell said . “ It definitely could have been a different game if they score a run or two there . ” 	 Pitching with a 2 - 1 lead
column7: Cleveland closer Emmanuel Clase was pumping in 100 mph fastballs and retired the first two batters in the bottom of the ninth . Max Schrock then hit a grounder through Naylor for a two - base error and Jesse Winker followed with an RBI single . 	 “ He just missed the ball . I do n’t know what else to tell you
column8: " Indians manager Terry Francona said . 	 Eugenio Suárez started the Reds 10th as the automatic runner on second and moved to third on Tyler Naquin ’s flyout . After an intentional walk
column9: Stephenson singled to deep right off Oliver Perez ( 0 - 1 ) . 	 “ Really just looking for a good pitch to hit
column10: ” Stephenson said . “ I was prepared for it and got a sinker out over ( the plate ) and hit it to right field . I was on time
column11: and I got it . ” 	 Sean Doolittle ( 2 - 0 ) pitched a scoreless 10th . 	 Eddie Rosario hit an RBI triple for the Indians in the third . Andres Giménez homered in the fourth . 	 Sonny Gray made his first appearance of the season for the Reds after being sidelined with a muscle strain in his back . He gave up two runs and six hits
column12: striking out six over 4 1/3 innings . 	 Tucker Barnhart homered in the Reds second . 	 Indians starter Triston McKenzie struck out seven and gave up a run on five hits through five innings . 	 WHOOPS 	 Votto was thrown out in the fifth when he tried to score from first on a deep single by Naquin . With the ball already relayed to the infield
column13: Votto was sent by third base coach J.R. House and was out by so much he just stopped and let catcher Austin Hedges tag him to end the inning . 	 GRAY IN
column14: BEDROSIAN OUT 	 Gray officially came off the disabled list before Saturday ’s game
column15: and right - handed reliever Cam Bedrosian was designated for assignment . Bedrosian made the team out of spring training
column16: but had an 11.12 ERA in six appearances . 	 MORE HELP 	 To get some more depth in their taxed bullpen
column17: the Indians recalled rookie left - hander Sam Hentges from the alternate training site . To make roster room
column18: they sent outfielder Ben Gamel down . Cleveland used five relievers despite a good start by McKenzie . Hentges was n't one of them . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Reds 3B Mike Moustakas is n’t feeling well and was out of the lineup for the second straight day . Utility infielder Alex Blandino was put on the injured list
column19: and outfielder Mark Payton was recalled from the alternate site . 	 UP NEXT 	 The Indians send RHP Shane Bieber ( 1 - 1 )
column20: the reigning AL Cy Young Award winner
column21: against Reds LHP Wade Miley ( 2 - 0 ) in the finale of the series on Sunday afternoon . Bieber went nine innings in the Indians ' 2 - 0 win over the White Sox Tuesday
column22: extending his streak of to 15 starts with at least eight strikeouts . column1: DENVER -- — New York Mets pitcher Jacob deGrom struck out nine straight batters against Colorado on Saturday
column2: falling one shy of matching Tom Seaver 's major league record
column3: and finished with 14 strikeouts in a 4 - 3 win over the Rockies in a doubleheader opener . 	 Coming off a 14 - strikeout performance in a 3 - 0 loss to Philadelphia
column4: deGrom became just the ninth pitcher to strike out as many as nine in a row . 	 The streak ended in the fifth inning
column5: when the Rockies took a 3 - 1 lead with three unearned runs
column6: but the Mets rallied to win a series opener delayed a day by snow when pinch - hitter Jonathan Villar hit a tying double off Daniel Bard ( 0 - 1 ) in the seventh inning and Dominic Smith had a sacrifice fly . 	 Pete Alonso had homered in the sixth to pull the Mets within a run . 	 By winning the opener of a doubleheader of seven - inning games under coronavirus protocols
column7: the Mets extended a winning streak to four for the first time since 2019 . 	 DeGrom ( 1 - 0 ) allowed three unearned runs and three hits in six innings and walked one
column8: lowering his ERA to 0.45 . 	 He started the streak with a called third strike against Josh Fuentes for the first out of the second inning
column9: then got Sam Hillard and Dom Nunez swinging . 	 He struck out Chi Chi González
column10: Raimel Tapia and Ryan McMahon in the third
column12: Charlie Blackmon and C.J. Cron in the fourth . 	 Fuentes grounded an 0 - 1 pitch leading off the fifth and reached on a throwing error by second baseman Jeff McNeil
column13: ending the streak . 	 Detroit reliever Tyler Alexander was the previous pitcher to strike out nine in a row
column14: accomplishing the feat last Aug. 2 against Cincinnati . 	 Seaver set the record against San Diego on April 22
column16: striking out his final 10 batters in a 19 - strikeout performance . 	 Colorado took a 3 - 1 lead against deGrom later in the fifth when Nunez hit an RBI triple
column17: pinch - hitter Yonathan Daza hit a sacrifice fly and Tapia homered . All three runs were unearned because of McNeil ’s error . 	 Despite deGrom ’s 2.06 ERA in 78 starts since the start of the 2018 season coming in
column18: New York was 36 - 42 with him on the mound . 	 With nine strikeouts in a row
column19: deGrom matched the New York Giants ’ Mickey Welch against Cleveland on Aug. 28
column21: San Diego ’s Jake Peavy at Arizona on April 25
column23: the Marlins ’ Ricky Nolasco at Atlanta on Sept. 30
column25: the Los Angeles Dodgers ’ Aaron Harang against San Diego on April 13
column27: Detroit ’s Doug Fister against Kansas City on Sept. 27
column29: Washington ’s Max Scherzer against the Mets on Oc . 3
column31: and Alexander . 	 DeGrom extended his road unbeaten streak to 17 with the 48th double - digit strikeout game for the two - time NL Cy Young Award winner . 	 Edwin Díaz struck out the side for his first save this season . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Mets : INF José Peraza was optioned to the alternate training site to clear a roster spot for J.D. Davis
column32: who was activated from the 10 - day injured list . Davis bruised his left hand when hit by a pitch April 6 against Philadelphia . column1: MIAMI -- — 	 Jorge Alfaro hit a game - ending
column2: two - run double and the Miami Marlins rallied from two deficits in the ninth and 10th innings to beat the San Francisco Giants 7 - 6 Saturday night . 	 Corey Dickerson had four hits for the Marlins who have won six of seven . Alfaro ’s extra - base hit to win it was his first of the season . 	 “ “ I just tried to help the team
column4: who was hitting .192 before Saturday . “ I was looking for a pitch that I could make hard contact . ” 	 San Francisco led 5 - 3 before RBI singles in the ninth by Alfaro and Starling Marte off Jake McGee . The closer blew his first save in seven opportunities and threw 35 pitches in the inning
column5: retiring Adam Duvall on an inning - ending flyout that stranded the bases loaded . 	 “ It ’s still fairly easy to turn the page
column6: I would say it ’s always amnesia
column7: ” McGee said of his outing . “ If you can figure out what went wrong and why it went wrong
column8: you ’ll have something to work on towards the next game . ” 	 Brandon Belt ’s run - scoring double against Yimi García ( 2 - 1 ) put the Giants ahead 6 - 5 in the 10th . 	 Jazz Chisholm walked against Jarlin García ( 0 - 1 ) with one out in the bottom half
column9: joining the the pandemic - rules automatic runner to give Miami two on . Chad Wallach flied out
column10: and Alfaro lined a double that bounced to the left - field wall . 	 “ This is a group that went through a lot last year
column11: ” Miami manager Don Mattingly said . “ These guys are going to fight . We start the game with confidence . ” 	 Miami starter Sandy Alcantara allowed four runs and six hits in 6 1/3 innings with seven strikeouts . 	 “ Sandy was a little bit of a mystery because he was cruising all day and getting ahead
column12: ” Mattingly said . “ His pitch count was in a good spot . ” 	 Giants starter Aaron Sanchez gave up one run
column14: three walks and a hit batter in 4 2/3 innings . 	 San Francisco catcher Buster Posey was hit on the left elbow by Alcantara ’s final pitch . Posey went to first base and scored on a three - run homer by pinch - hitter Austin Slater off Richard Bleier
column15: which capped a five - run inning that put the Giants ahead 5 - 3 . Posey left the game before the bottom half . 	 The former NL MVP left with a bruise
column16: Giants manager Gabe Kapler said . 	 Belt homered leading off the seventh
column17: and Brandon Crawford had an RBI single . Belt has reached safely in 28 straight games against Miami . 	 “ I think that ’s the type of offense that we ’re capable of being and the type that can put up a big inning
column18: ” Kapler said . “ You win a lot of games when you have big innings . It ’s really tough to win one - run ball games . Your pitching has to be excellent . ” 	 Duvall tripled in a run in the first
column19: and Jesús Aguilar made it 3 - 0 with a two - run double off Matt Wisler in the sixth . 	 DEPLETED BENCHE : 	 The late scoring
column20: pinch - runners and the combined use of 11 relievers by both teams resulted in multiple double - switches and eventually depleted benches . Wallach was the last Miami position player available when he pinch hit
column21: and Giants pitcher Anthony DeSclafani pinch - hit in the top of the 10th . DeSclafani ’s sacrifice bunt attempt ended in a forceout at second . column2: Mo. -- — The Kansas City Royals and Toronto Blue Jays got wildly different yet equally effective pitching performances in splitting their day - night doubleheader on Saturday . 	 In the opener
column3: starter Steven Matz held the Royals without a hit into the sixth inning
column4: and Jonathan Davis and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. homered to give the Blue Jays a 5 - 1 victory . In the nightcap
column5: the Royals followed veteran Ervin Santana 's spot start with four relief pitchers before Salvador Perez 's two - out
column6: walk - off homer gave them a 3 - 2 win . 	 Greg Holland ( 2 - 1 ) was the last of the relievers in Game 2 for Kansas City
column7: working around an error in the seventh inning to keep the game tied 2 - all . Joel Payamps ( 0 - 1 ) then retired Whit Merrifield and Andrew Benintendi in the bottom half before Perez sent a pitch splashing into the left - field fountains to earn the doubleheader split . 	 “ He never ceases to amaze us with what he does
column8: " Royals manager Mike Matheny said . “ I think he was tired of waiting around for someone to get on base
column9: ” 	 Or maybe he was just ready to go home after Friday 's rainout forced them to play a doubleheader . 	 The afternoon began with Matz ( 3 - 0 ) allowing just a pair of walks before Nicky Lopez 's blooper with one out in the sixth inning . He gave up Benintendi 's two - out double later in the inning for the only other blemish on an otherwise excellent outing — six innings
column10: five strikeouts and just five balls that left the infield . 	 “ It 's fun to get in a groove early in the season
column11: especially when you have a lineup like this
column13: who struggled with injuries throughout his six seasons with the Mets . “ Get a little better every time out . That 's the goal going forward . ” 	 Other than a shaky first
column14: the Royals ’ Mike Minor matched Matz pitch for pitch most of the way . 	 Minor ( 1 - 1 ) retired his first two batters before Guerrero and Randal Grichuk hit back - to - back singles and Lourdes Gurriel Jr. drilled a two - run double off the wall . That was all the runs until Davis hit his first homer
column15: a drive off the left - field foul pole leading off the fifth . Guerrero tagged his second homer of the series leading off the sixth . 	 “ Always looking for the first one
column16: ” Davis said
column17: “ and now I can breath a little bit . ” 	 Even if Matz did n't allow a hit all game
column18: his sterling start would n't have been an official no - hitter because teams or pitchers must play at least nine innings to qualify . The decision to shorten doubleheader games to seven innings apiece for the 2021 season means Matz and the Blue Jays would have needed at least two extra innings for it to count . 	 The only no - hitter in Blue Jays history is Dave Stieb ’s 3 - 0 win over the Indians on Sept. 2
column19: 1990 . 	 “ We ran into a good start today . Matz was throwing the ball well
column20: ” Matheny said . “ He had good late movement — you could tell the guys were n't seeing the late movement . Really baring in
column21: using the back door . ” 	 The second game was tied 2 - all in the fourth inning
column22: turning it into a chess match between bullpens . The Blue Jays ' finally cracked when Payamps
column23: their fourth reliever after spot - starter Tommy Milone
column24: served up Perez 's game - ending homer . 	 “ We knew we had well - rested arms in the bullpen ready for leverage
column25: ” Matheny said . “ I thought everybody did a nice job coming through . That ’s a tough one . All of them did a fantastic job of keeping us right there with a good offense . ” 	 WALK THIS WAY 	 Royals 1B Carlos Santana drew his 1
column26: 000th walk leading off the seventh inning of the opener
column27: joining Albert Pujols
column28: Joey Votto and Miguel Cabrera as the only active players in the club . 	 “ Happy . Happy and blessed
column29: ” Santana said . “ It 's another point in my career . ” 	 THE OTHER SANTANA 	 Well - traveled Ervin Santana made his first big league appearance since April 24
column31: with the White Sox at Baltimore
column32: and he made his first start for Kansas City since Sept. 25
column34: 761 days between games are the fourth - longest in franchise history . Santana also became the fourth - oldest starter in club history at 38 years
column35: 126 days . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Blue Jays : OF George Springer ( quadriceps and oblique ) is doing some light running and will begin taking batting practice
column36: but manager Charlie Montoyo said there is still no timeframe for his return . 	 TRADE WINDS 	 The Royals traded OF Nick Heath to the Diamondbacks for minor league RHP Eduardo Herrera . Heath had been designated for assignment earlier in the week . The 21 - year - old Herrera has yet to pitch above Class A as a professional . 	 UP NEXT 	 The Blue Jays send LHP Robbie Ray ( 0 - 1
column37: 3.60 ERA ) to the mound against Royals RHP Brady Singer ( 0 - 2
column38: 6.48 ) in the series finale Sunday . column2: Texas -- — Trey Mancini had a tiebreaking RBI double in the eighth inning and the Baltimore Orioles won 6 - 1 at Texas on Saturday night
column3: getting their runs against three relievers after Rangers rookie starter Dane Dunning threw six scoreless innings . 	 The Orioles snapped a 1 - 1 tie off lefty Joely Rodriguez ( 0 - 1 ) in his season debut . DJ Stewart and Maikel Franco had consecutive singles to start the eighth before Mancini doubled to left . Ryan Mountcastle then had a sacrifice fly when Gold Glove - winning right fielder Joey Gallo made a leaping catch on the warning track . 	 Freddy Galvis
column5: had two - out double off Taylor Hearn in the seventh and scored Baltimore 's first run just ahead of a throw by Gallo when Cedric Mullins singled   him home . Franco hit a two - run homer in the ninth off Brett de Gues . 	 “ Just big to get the lead and tack on runs
column6: one thing that we ’ve kind of been short on the last few years
column7: ” Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said . “ I was really impressed with our at - bats the last few innings . ” 	 Travis Lakins ( 1 - 0 )
column8: the third of five Baltimore pitchers
column9: threw a scoreless inning . 	 Mancini missed all of the pandemic - shortened 2020 season during treatment for colon cancer . Hyde said before the game that Mancini was putting so much pressure on himself and trying so hard after a year away
column10: so the 29 - year - old first baseman was the DH for only the second time
column11: and dropped to fifth in the order . 	 After striking out four times in the series opener Friday
column13: Mancini was hitting .145 . He then had hits his next two at - bats . 	 " To see him deliver in a couple of big spots
column14: the base hit to right and then the ball down the left - field line
column15: that 's huge for us and huge for him
column16: ” Hyde said . 	 Dunning extended his scoreless streak to 14 innings . The 26 - year - old right - hander was acquired when the Rangers traded workhorse veteran starter Lance Lynn to the Chicago White Sox in December . 	 He struck out five while scattering five singles on his 75 pitches
column17: and has n't given up a run since a homer in the first inning of his first start . He has n't thrown a four - seam fastball all season
column18: relying instead on sliders and sinkers . 	 “ For the most part
column19: I trust what I ’ve got and try to fill the zone as much as possible
column20: ” Dunning said . “ I 'm not going to be able to blow fastballs by people . " 	 Texas led 1 - 0 in the fourth on David Dahl 's RBI single against rookie right - hander Dean Kremer
column21: who struck out six and walked one in his 4 2/3 innings . The Orioles got out of the fourth on a inning - ending double play after shortstop Galvis made a sliding stop up the middle . 	 “ That ’s a game - saver to turn two right there
column22: ” Kremer said . 	 SHORT HOPS 	 The Rangers have lost five in a row at their second - year ballpark . “ I ’m not overly concerned about it . But we ’ve obviously got to produce more at home ... We 've got to find ways to win in this ballpark
column25: is 6 - 2 on the road . ... Gallo 's MLB - leading 15th walk in the eighth extended his season - opening on - base streak to 15 games . The last Rangers player with a longer streak to start a season was Ian Kinsler 's 25 in a row in 2008 . 	 SCORELESS STREAKS 	 Going into Saturday ’s games
column26: only three pitchers had scoreless streaks of at least 14 innings this year . San Diego right - hander Joe Musgrove at 16
column27: including his no - hitter at Texas on April 9 and Lynn at 15 2/3 innings
column28: while Carlos Rodon of the White Sox has an active streak of 14 in a row after his no - hitter Wednesday against Cleveland . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Orioles : LF Austin Hays ( right hamstring strain )
column29: on the injured list since April 5
column30: likely will rejoin the Orioles for their series opener at Miami on Tuesday . “ He ’s progressed very well
column31: played the last couple days and has checked all the boxes from a health standpoint
column32: ” Hyde said . 	 Rangers : DH Willie Calhoun ( left groin strain ) and 3B Brock Holt ( right hamstring strain ) were both activated from the injured list and were in the starting lineup . The Rangers optioned LHP Wes Benjamin and INF Anderson Tejeda to their alternate training site . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rangers RHP Kyle Gibson ( 2 - 0

column1: MILWAUKEE -- — Brett Anderson pitched seven effective innings and the Milwaukee Brewers built a big lead early and breezed past the Pittsburgh Pirates 7 - 1 on Saturday night . 	 Jackie Bradley Jr. hit a leadoff single in the first inning and the Brewers went on to score five times
column2: with every run coming with two outs . Bradley
column4: tripled and scored in the second as Milwaukee made it 7 - 0 . 	 “ I would rather not hit in the first inning
column5: but we ’ll take it . We ’ve come out and hit the ball well
column6: ” Anderson said . 	 Anderson ( 2 - 1 ) and Pittsburgh starter Trevor Cahill ( 0 - 2 )
column7: both 33 and having started their major league careers in 2009
column8: made their third starts of the season . They had had rough first starts
column10: both gave up just one run in five innings . 	 Their paths diverged Saturday . 	 Anderson allowed one unearned run and six hits
column11: walking one and striking out three . The Pirates ' run scored on one of three throwing errors by shortstop Luis Urías . 	 Cahill
column12: signed as a free agent on March 21 and playing for his eighth team since 2015
column13: retired the last seven hitters he faced before his outing ended after four innings . 	 Noting the Brewers ' five first - inning runs came on six singles
column15: Cahill said “ they could have all been solo homers . It ’s just a hit . You ’re trying to compete and just not let them reach base . ” 	 Bradley singled
column16: stole second and scored on a bloop single that broke Avisail García 's bat . Two runs later scored when center fielder Anthony Alford misplayed a single by Urías . 	 Pittsburgh coaxed across its run in the fourth . Bryan Reynolds singled
column17: took second on a passed ball and later scored when Urías threw away a grounder by Jacob Stallings . 	 The Brewers
column18: who have made the playoffs the past three seasons
column19: prevailed despite putting Christian Yelich
column21: being put on the 10 - day injured list with a sore back . 	 “ It ’s disappointing not to be out there . It ’s frustrating that it popped up again
column22: ” Yelich said of his back problems . 	 The Pirates
column23: who finished last in the NL Central in 2020 and 2019
column24: had won five of their past seven . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Pirates : 3B Ke’Bryan Hayes ( left wrist strain )
column25: a preseason favorite for NL Rookie of the Year
column26: has been on the 10 - day injured list since April 4 . The son of 14 - year big leaguer Charlie Hayes hit .376 with five home runs in 24 games in 2020 . Hayes did some hitting on the field Saturday for the first time
column27: manager Derek Shelton said . 	 Brewers : RHP Eric Yardley was recalled from the organization ’s alternate training site in Appleton
column28: Wisconsin
column29: due to the injury to Yelich
column30: and pitched the eighth . Yelich
column31: who had missed four straight games
column33: along with 2B Kolten Wong and OF Lorenzo Cain
column34: currently sidelined . Wong ( left oblique strain )
column35: the lead - off hitter in each game he has started in 2021

column37: a Gold Glove winner in 2019 and 2020

He ’s hitting .154 with two home runs . ... “ We ’ll just have to fill in around them until those guys get back . We ’re not expecting this to be long term
column39: ” manager Craig Counsell said . 	 UP NEXT 	 The teams ’ three - game series concludes with Pirates RHP Chad Kuhl ( 0 - 1

column1: DENVER -- — Jacob deGrom struck out nine straight batters against Colorado on Saturday
column2: falling one shy of matching Tom Seaver ’s major league record . 	 He fell short of the record and nearly missed a win . 	 DeGrom finished with 14 strikeouts to lead the New York Mets over the Rockies 4 - 3 in a doubleheader opener . 	 German Márquez pitched a two - hitter for his second career complete as the Rockies won the nightcap 7 - 2
column3: stopping a seven - game losing streak and the Mets ’ four - game winning streak . Josh Fuentes broke open the game with a three - run homer in the fifth off Jacob Barnes . 	 DeGrom
column4: a two - time NL Cy Young Award winner
column5: wound up with a win when trailing at his final pitch
column6: just the third time that has happened and the first since 2015 . 	 Seaver set the consecutive strikeouts record against San Diego on April 22
column8: fanning his final 10 batters in a 19 - strikeout performance . 	 “ That would have been nice to reach but fell a little short
column9: ” deGrom said with a smile . 	 Coming off a 14 - strikeout performance in a 3 - 0 loss to Philadelphia
column10: deGrom became just the ninth pitcher to strike out as many as nine in a row . 	 “ The fastball was the best weapon for him
column11: ” Mets manager Luis Rojas said . “ It ’s special . You do n’t see that often . You talk about Jake getting better every year and he goes out there
column12: and we talked about the challenge of the weather
column13: so it ’s a little bit of a different start . He makes an adjustment and does something special . ” 	 The streak ended in the fifth inning
column14: when the Rockies took a 3 - 1 lead with three unearned runs
column15: but the Mets rallied to win a series opener delayed a day by snow when pinch - hitter Jonathan Villar hit a tying double off Daniel Bard ( 0 - 1 ) in the seventh inning and Dominic Smith had a sacrifice fly . 	 Pete Alonso had homered in the sixth to pull the Mets within a run . 	 By winning the opener of a doubleheader of seven - inning games under coronavirus protocols
column16: the Mets extended a winning streak to four for the first time since 2019 . Joey Lucchesi ( 0 - 1 ) allowed four hits and three runs over three innings in taking the loss in the second game . 	 DeGrom ( 1 - 1 ) allowed three unearned runs and three hits in six innings and walked one
column17: lowering his ERA to 0.45 . 	 He started the streak with a called third strike against Josh Fuentes for the first out of the second inning
column18: then got Sam Hillard and Dom Nunez swinging . 	 He struck out Chi Chi González
column19: Raimel Tapia and Ryan McMahon in the third
column21: Charlie Blackmon and C.J. Cron in the fourth . 	 Fuentes grounded an 0 - 1 pitch leading off the fifth and reached on a throwing error by second baseman Jeff McNeil
column22: ending the streak . 	 “ I would have liked to have fielded it
column23: but my glove hit my leg
column24: ” deGrom said of Fuentes ’ grounder . “ That ’s where we had him played . McNeil was there and he felt bad about it . I told him
column25: ‘ Keep your head up
column26: ’ and we ended up winning the ballgame . ” 	 Detroit reliever Tyler Alexander was the previous pitcher to strike out nine in a row
column27: accomplishing the feat last Aug. 2 against Cincinnati . 	 Colorado took a 3 - 1 lead against deGrom later in the fifth when Nunez hit an RBI triple
column28: pinch - hitter Yonathan Daza hit a sacrifice fly and Tapia homered . All three runs were unearned because of McNeil ’s error . 	 Despite deGrom ’s 2.03 ERA in 79 starts since the start of the 2018 season coming in
column29: New York was 37 - 42 with him on the mound . 	 With nine strikeouts in a row
column30: deGrom matched the New York Giants ’ Mickey Welch against Cleveland on Aug. 28
column32: San Diego ’s Jake Peavy at Arizona on April 25
column34: the Marlins ’ Ricky Nolasco at Atlanta on Sept. 30
column36: the Los Angeles Dodgers ’ Aaron Harang against San Diego on April 13
column38: Detroit ’s Doug Fister against Kansas City on Sept. 27
column40: Washington ’s Max Scherzer against the Mets on Oc . 3
column42: and Alexander . 	 DeGrom extended his road unbeaten streak to 17 with the 48th double - digit strikeout game for the two - time NL Cy Young Award winner . 	 “ His fastball had life
column43: ” Colorado manager Bud Black said . “ His slider had a good break down in the zone
column44: did n’t make too many mistakes with the slider . His fastball at the top of the zone gets big league hitters throughout the National League . That ’s where he gets a lot of his strikeouts
column45: on that high fastball . But he ’s able to command the corners with the heater
column46: too . ” 	 Edwin Díaz struck out the side for his first save this season . 	 Márquez ( 1 - 1 ) struck out six with a pair of walks . 	 Mets starter Joey Lucchesi allowed three runs and four hits over three innings in his first appearance since April 7 and his first start for New York . 	 SWING AND A HIT 	 DeGrom also helped himself with a single to start the third and then scored on a single by Alonso . DeGrom has had at least one hit in each of his first three starts . “ I ’m just trying to see the ball and hit it and not be an automatic out . ” SWEET ENDING 	 Pulling out a win in the nightcap left the struggling Rockies with a soothing feeling for the moment in the club house . “ It was a good time
column47: ” Fuentes said . “ It just gives us a little momentum
column48: a little confidence . ” 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Mets : INF José Peraza was optioned to the alternate training site to clear a roster spot for J.D. Davis
column49: who was activated from the 10 - day injured list . Davis bruised his left hand when hit by a pitch April 6 against Philadelphia . RHP Franklyn Kilome was sent outright to the alternate training site . 	 UP NEXT 	 RHP Marcus Stroman ( 2 - 0 ) starts for the Mets on Sunday and RHP Antonio Senzatela ( 1 - 2 ) for the Rockies . 	 ------ 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . column1: SAN DIEGO -- — Mookie Betts made an outstanding diving catch and Clayton Kershaw starred on the mound and at the plate
column2: helping the Los Angeles Dodgers top the San Diego Padres 2 - 0 on Saturday night in another compelling thriller between the NL West rivals . 	 Kershaw ( 3 - 1 ) struck out eight while working six innings of three - hit ball . He also drew a bases - loaded walk against Yu Darvish ( 1 - 1 ) in the fifth
column3: leading Los Angeles to its eighth straight win . 	 “ We knew that this was going to be an emotionally intense ( series ) obviously coming here
column4: ” Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said . “ It certainly lived up to the billing . ” 	 Even with Kershaw 's stellar performance
column5: the matchup was n't decided until Betts turned in another memorable play for the final out . 	 With runners on second and third
column6: Tommy Pham hit a sinking liner to center that looked as if it was going to tie the game . But Betts got over for a terrific diving grab
column7: and then pounded on his chest in celebration . 	 “ It takes an elite defender in center to make that play . A lot of things have got to line up
column8: ” Roberts said . “ There are just a handful of guys that probably could have made that play . It just speaks to that is why he is arguably the best all - around player in baseball . ” 	 Justin Turner
column9: who homered in the ninth for Los Angeles
column10: said Betts saved the game for the World Series champions . 	 “ He is a guy who can change the game and impact the game in so many different ways
column11: " Turner said . 	 Said Kershaw : “ That play is really hard to make . For him to be able to do that is just another reason why Mookie is the best . ” 	 Los Angeles also took the series opener Friday night
column12: grabbing the lead for good when Corey Seager hit a tiebreaking two - run homer on Tim Hill ’s first pitch of the 12th inning . 	 The second game of the season series was just as good . 	 Kershaw won his third straight start since losing at Colorado on opening day . Victor Gonzalez got two outs for his first save of the season . 	 Darvish was terrific for San Diego
column13: allowing one hit in seven innings . He struck out nine and walked two . 	 Los Angeles grabbed the lead with a two - out rally in the fifth . Zach McKinstry was hit by a pitch
column14: Luke Raley singled and Austin Barnes walked to load the bases . 	 Kershaw then walked on a full - pitch count
column15: forcing in a run . Darvish ’s 86 - mph cutter was slightly low and outside . 	 San Diego had runners on the corners with one out in the sixth when Wil Myers hit a sharp grounder up the middle . Second baseman Chris Taylor grabbed the ball
column16: stepped on second and threw to first baseman Max Muncy for a double play to end the inning . 	 Turner gave the Dodgers an insurance run with a solo drive off Emilio Pagan in the ninth . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Dodgers : Infielder Gavin Lux was available to pinch run
column17: but he was n't allowed to hit due to a sore right wrist . 	 Padres : Placed RHP Dan Altavilla on the 10 - day injured list with right elbow inflammation . LHP Matt Strahm ( right patellar tendon repair ) was transferred to the 60 - day IL . ... 3B Manny Machado started despite jamming a shoulder sliding into second base and having back spasms on Friday night . 	 UP NEXT 	 Dodgers right - hander Trevor Bauer ( 2 - 0

column1: SEATTLE -- — Zack Greinke pitched eight sharp innings
column2: rookie Taylor Jones drove in the only run and the depleted Houston Astros ended a six - game losing streak
column3: edging the Seattle Mariners 1 - 0 Saturday night . 	 Greinke allowed four hits and walked none . He struck out six
column4: two of them on 67 mph curveballs . 	 “ That 's what aces do
column5: ” Astros manager Dusty Baker said . “ Guys like him ... they stop the bleeding and we 're about bled out . ” 	 Ryan Pressly pitched the ninth for his first save
column6: though Baker said he considered letting Greinke go for the complete game after an eight - pitch eighth inning . 	 “ It 's fun to watch him
column7: " Pressly said . " I wish we had a better view instead of all the way out in the bullpen . It 's fun to watch how he manipulates pitches
column8: the way he moves them in and out . We were talking about it in the clubhouse : He 's like an artist when he 's out there . ” 	 Jones
column11: hit an RBI single with two outs in the fourth . He has been pressed into service after five Astros – including starters Jose Altuve
column12: Alex Bregman and Yordan Álvarez – were moved to the injured list due to COVID-19 protocols on Wednesday . 	 Greinke
column14: made a brilliant defensive play in the fifth when he gathered in J.P. Crawford ’s hard grounder
column15: freezing two runners on base
column16: and threw to third to start a double play . Greinke methodically surveyed each base before making the right decision to throw to third . 	 “ There 's a million things going through your mind in a short time
column17: ” Greinke said . 	 Greinke finished the game with 2
column18: 705 career strikeouts . His teammate
column19: Justin Verlander ( 18th at 3
column21: and the Washington Nationals ’ Max Scherzer ( 22nd at 2
column22: 808 ) are the only active players ahead of him on the career list . 	 “ Sometimes you pitch and you think it 's really hard
column24: ” Greinke said . “ Things were happening how I wanted them to . It was nice . ” 	 Seattle right - hander Chris Flexen ( 1 - 1 ) permitted 10 hits in six innings . He struck out three and walked none . 	 The Mariners had won three in a row . 	 “ Greinke was on top of his game
column25: ” Seattle manager Scott Servais said . “ We 've seen him do that before . When he 's living on the edges like that
column26: and then back and forth with the slow curveball
column27: he 's tough to get out . He just did n't make a lot of mistakes tonight . ” 	 COVID-19 UPDATES 	 Astros : Baker said starting pitcher Lance McCullers Jr. might not make his scheduled start Wednesday at Colorado due to the lingering effects of his COVID-19 vaccine . 	 “ He ’s feeling better
column28: but he ’s still not 100 %
column29: ” Baker said . “ If you ’re not 100 % and having trouble breathing
column30: Colorado is not the place to get your breath back . ” 	 Baker had no new update on the five players who were put on the injured list due to COVID-19 protocols
column31: but he does n't expect them to play through the end of Houston ’s five - game road trip to Seattle and Colorado . 	 Mariners : Servais called a Saturday informational meeting with Dr. Vin Gupta “ fantastic ” and “ very impactful
column32: ” and hopes Seattle will reach an 85 % vaccination rate
column33: the level at which MLB officials will relax some restrictions . Gupta
column34: who became a go - to television personality during the pandemic
column35: is Amazon ’s principal scientist and a professor of health metrics sciences at the University of Washington ’s Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Astros : LHP Blake Taylor will go on the 10 - day injured list
column36: Baker said . Taylor rolled his right ankle while trying to make a scoop toss at first base on a chopper from Taylor Trammell in Friday night ’s 6 - 5 loss to the Mariners . It was his seventh appearance of the season
column37: tied for the team lead . “ Hopefully he ’s a quick healer because we need him
column38: ” Baker said . Taylor will be replaced on the roster by RHP Peter Solomon
column39: a projected starting pitcher who likely will now make his major league debut out of the bullpen . 	 UP NEXT 	 Astros : RHP Jake Odorizzi ( 0 - 1
column40: 13.50 ERA ) closes out the Seattle series after he gave up five runs over 3 1/3 innings in his season - opening appearance Tuesday at Detroit . 	 Mariners : LHP Nick Margevicius ( 0 - 1

column1: WASHINGTON -- — Madison Bumgarner had his best outing of the season
column2: allowing a run over five innings as the Arizona Diamondbacks beat Washington 5 - 2 Sunday after Nationals starter Stephen Strasburg was a late scratch . 	 Bumgarner ( 1 - 2 ) gave up just two hits and dropped his ERA from 11.20 to 8.68 through four starts . He struck out five and walked one
column3: helping Arizona split the four - game series . 	 “ We ’re super excited for him
column4: ” manager Torey Lovullo said . 	 Bumgarner — who played on three World Series champion teams during his 11 seasons in San Francisco and earned 2014 World Series MVP — had given up at least five earned runs in each of his first three starts in his second season in Arizona . 	 “ He ’s a tough man
column5: ” Lovullo said . “ He put San Fran on his shoulders for several years and that ’s his expectation . ” 	 Strasburg — also a World Series MVP
column6: in 2019 — was placed on the 10 - day injured list before first pitch with right shoulder inflammation . Strasburg felt discomfort after a bullpen session during the week
column7: and later an MRI later revealed inflammation . Manager Dave Martinez said there was no timetable for his return . 	 Josh Rojas hit his first career leadoff homer
column8: connecting against Nationals last - minute starter Paulo Espino . The 34 - year - old Espino made his fourth career start in the majors and second with Washington . 	 Espino ( 0 - 1 ) pitched 4 1/3 innings and allowed two earned runs and five hits while striking out three and giving up a walk . Two of those five hits were solo home runs — Carson Kelly led off the fourth with a shot to left field . 	 Trea Turner hit two solo homers
column9: one to left field in the third off Bumgarner and his second of the game to center in the eighth off Taylor Clarke . It was Turner ’s sixth multi - home run game and first since Sept. 20
column10: 2019 at Miami . Turner has four homers this season . Washington dropped to 5 - 8 . 	 Pavin Smith had an RBI double in the seventh as Arizona won for the second time in six games to improve to 6 - 10 . 	 Stefan Crichton earned his first save of the season . 	 MAKING THE MOST 	 Nick Heath
column11: acquired from Kansas City in a trade on Saturday
column12: made his Arizona debut for the injured Tim Locastro in center field and had three hits . Coming into the game
column13: Heath had just two hits in 13 at - bats . 	 “ The last couple of days has been a roller coaster of emotions
column14: ” Heath said . “ I got the call that I got traded . Crazy enough
column15: here I am in DC instead of Northwest Arkansas ( Royals alternate site ) . ” 	 STRUGGLING STRAS 	 Before landing on the IL
column16: Strasburg was off to a rough start . The 32 - year - old is 0–1 with a 6.30 ERA in two starts this season . He gave up three homers and seven earned runs in four innings in his last start
column17: a 14 - 3 loss in St. Louis on Tuesday . 	 Strasburg signed a $ 245 million
column18: seven - year contract before the 2020 season with Washington . 	 “ He ’s a guy that we expect to go out there every night and pitch a lot of innings and win a lot of ballgames for us
column19: ” Turner said . “ So
column21: it definitely hurts . ” 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Diamondbacks : Placed Locastro on the 10 - day injured with a dislocated left pinkie finger . Locastro was hurt Saturday while trying to extend his major league record of 29 consecutive stolen bases to begin a career . 	 Nationals : Relief pitcher Wander Suero ( left oblique strain ) was placed on the 10 - day injured list and Washington recalled righty Ryne Harper from the alternate training site . Suero has a 1.42 ERA this season in eight appearances . ... LHP Jon Lester is schedule to throw a sim game Tuesday with manager Dave Martinez hoping he will get to five innings or 80 - 85 pitches . Lester was put on the injured list April 6 under COVID-19 protocols . 	 UP NEXT 	 Diamondbacks : RHP Zac Gallen ( 0 - 0
column22: 2.25 ERA ) will take the mound in the series opener at Cincinnati on Tuesday . Gallen lost his only previous start against the Reds in 2019 . 	 Nationals : RHP Joe Ross ( 1 - 0
column23: 0.00 ERA ) will make his second straight start against the Cardinals as Washington ’s homestand continues on Monday . Ross pitched six scoreless innings in Washington ’s 6 - 0 win in St. Louis on April 14 in his last start . 	 ------ 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: ST . LOUIS -- — St. Louis Cardinals catcher Yadier Molina was put on the 10 - day injured list Tuesday with a strained tendon in his right foot . 	 Molina was hurt in a game Friday night against Cincinnati . He sat out Saturday and Sunday
column2: then returned on Monday to catch all nine innings of a 2 - 1 loss to Philadelphia . 	 The nine - time Gold Glove winner said he “ had trouble moving around
column3: ” manager Mike Shildt said . 	 The 38 - year - old Molina is off to one of the best starts of his career . He is hitting .323 with five home runs and 14 RBI . 	 This was the ninth time he has gone on the injured list during his 18 - year career . 	 Andrew Knizner started Tuesday night 's game against the Phillies . column1: NEW YORK -- — Gerrit Cole shook his head
column2: disgusted . Aaron Hicks put hands on hips and bowed his head . By the end of the afternoon
column3: pretty much all of the New York Yankees were appalled
column4: along with their loudly booing fans . 	 Yoshi Tsutsugo hit a tiebreaking double off Cole in the seventh inning that lifted the Tampa Bay Rays to a 4 - 2 win Sunday and a three - game sweep that extended the Yankees ' losing streak to five games . New York fell to an AL - worst 5 - 10
column5: its poorest start since 1997 . 	 “ I ’m frustrated
column7: ” said AL batting champion DJ LeMahieu
column8: who concluded the Yankees were “ tight and pressing . ” 	 “ No one ’s going to feel sorry for us
column9: " he said . " No one ’s going to throw softer or throw easier for us . We ’ve got to find it within ourselves to to continue to get better and play the way we ’re capable of . ” 	 Opener Andrew Kittredge
column11: Diego Castillo and Jeffrey Springs ( first big league save ) combined on the Rays ’ second three - hitter of a series in which New York managed 11 hits in all . Tampa Bay outscored the Yankees 17 - 7
column12: and New York pushed across just three runs other than on homers . 	 “ We got great players in that room
column13: ” Yankees manager Aaron Boone insisted . “ They do know that at their core
column15: we ’re getting punched in the mouth right now . ” 	 Cole ( 2 - 1 ) was hurt by slipshod defense that made three mistakes in the Rays ’ two - run third inning alone
column16: two by Hicks in center and one by Clint Frazier in left . One of the three runs off Cole was unearned
column17: giving the Yankees a major league - high . 	 Joey Wendle added a ninth - inning homer off Darren O’Day
column18: prompting boos from the crowd of 10
column20: who saved their loudest jeers for the final out . 	 New York has lost five straight for the first time since Sept. 4 - 8
column21: getting outscored 30 - 14 . 	 “ You have to strap your boots on and wade through the mud a little bit
column22: ” Cole said . " If we stay in that mindset and we leave the field every day exhausted
column23: good things are on the horizon
column24: but I do n’t have the magic wand . I do n’t know when it ’s going to turn . ” 	 Aaron Judge struck out three times and is 4 for his last 28
column25: Hicks has 1 hit in his last 15 at - bats
column26: Gleyber Torres 3 in his last 24
column27: and Giancarlo Stanton
column28: despite a second - inning home run
column29: is 3 for his last 26 . Frazier is 1 for his last 24 and does not have an RBI in 40 plate appearances this season . 	 New York 's batting average is down to .210
column30: one point above AL - worst Cleveland . 	 Boone said his hitters have to guard against “ being obsessed with chasing a result
column31: which is hard to do when you get off to a slow start individually . You want to get a hit so bad that that can sometimes work against you . ” 	 Yarbrough allowed one run and two hits in five innings
column32: and the Rays beat the Yankees for the 18th time in 23 meetings
column33: including in last year ’s Division Series . Tampa Bay swept a series for the second time in its last three visits to Yankee Stadium after sweeping just two of their previous 51 series of three games or more in the Bronx . 	 “ It ’s just not an easy thing to do . It does n’t happen very often
column34: ” Rays manager Kevin Cash said . “ So you ’ve got to enjoy it when it does . ” 	 Cole retired 13 in a row before Wendle singled with one out in the seventh . Tsutsugo
column36: followed by driving a changeup to right - center for an RBI double and a 3 - 2 lead . 	 Tampa Bay had gone ahead 2 - 1 in the third after Mike Zunino 's leadoff single . Hicks got a late break on Kevin Kiermaier ’s bloop to short center
column37: then bobbled the ball and lost a chance for a forceout at second . Yandy Díaz followed with an RBI single as Hicks allowed the ball to kick off his glove for an error that let Kiermaier take third . 	 Frazier heaved the ball past second as Díaz advanced on Manuel Margot 's go - ahead sacrifice fly . 	 LeMahieu hit a tying single in the fifth
column38: when Yarbrough struck out Judge with two on and two out . Tampa Bay
column39: off to a slow start in the defense of its AL pennant
column40: got back to .500 at 8 - 8 . 	 “ We just wanted to kind of get back on track
column41: ” Yarbrough said . 	 K CORNER 	 Cole struck out 10 in 6 1/3 innings and with 39 strikeouts set a Yankees mark for most in his first four starts
column42: with three more than Masahiro Tanaka in 2014 . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Rays : RHP Collin McHugh ( low back strain ) was put on the 10 - day IL and RHP Chris Mazza was recalled from the taxi squad . 	 Yankees : 1B Luke Voit ( knee surgery March 29 ) is to start swinging a bat Tuesday . ... RHP Domingo Germán will be recalled from the alternate training site this week . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rays : LHP Josh Fleming starts Monday at Kansas City . Fleming is from Bridgeton
column43: Missouri
column44: and is expecting about 12 family members and 25 friends
column45: many of whom have not seen him pitch since 2018 at Bowling Green . “ Any time I hear screaming
column46: I ’ll know it ’s going to be from there
column49: were forced by the pandemic to watch his debut on television at a hotel across from Tropicana Field but did attend World Series games . column1: BOSTON -- — Tim Anderson homered on the game ’s first pitch
column2: Dallas Keuchel pitched five solid innings and the Chicago White Sox beat the Boston Red Sox 3 - 2 on Sunday in the opener of a split - admission doubleheader . 	 Yasmani Grandal had an RBI double and Yoán Moncada drove in a run with a single for the White Sox
column3: who had lost three straight . 	 It was just the second loss in the last 12 for the Red Sox
column4: who wore their yellow - and - blue City Series uniforms for the second straight game . 	 Kiké Hernández homered around the right - field foul pole for Boston
column5: which entered the day with a majors ’ most seven come - from - behind victories . 	 Anderson sent Tanner Houck ’s 96.8 mph fastball in Boston ’s bullpen . 	 “ I was looking for something in my zone
column6: ” Anderson said . “ I was able to go deep into right field . One - nothing . Everybody was fired up . One pitch
column7: one run . ” 	 The doubleheader was scheduled after Friday ’s game was postponed due to snow and rain . The second game is slated to start at 5:05 p.m. 	 Keuchel ( 1 - 0 ) gave up two runs and six hits
column8: breezing through the first seven batters before Bobby Dalbec doubled high off the Green Monster . Liam Hendriks got the final three outs for his second save
column9: striking out Dalbec with a runner on first for the final out . 	 “ Outstanding
column10: ” White Sox manager Tony La Russa said of Keuchel 's outing . “ They lead the league in hitting
column11: they have threats one - through - nine . He was outstanding . ” 	 The game lasted just 2 hours
column12: 4 minutes . 	 “ I love it . I liked it last year as a fan and I like it as a manager
column13: ” Boston 's Alex Cora said of seven - inning doubleheaders . 	 Making his fifth major league start
column14: Houck ( 0 - 2 ) gave up three runs and six hits over 4 1/3 innings . 	 Red Sox right fielder Hunter Renfroe made a nice over - the - shoulder running grab on the track and had an RBI single . 	 Boston 's uniforms — void of any red — honor the Boston Marathon with the colors that stretch across the finish line of the famous race . They featured bright yellow tops with powder - blue lettering across the front
column15: numbers on the back and caps
column16: with white pants . They even had matching blue batting helmets . 	 For the first time since the Red Sox started playing their annual Patriots ’ Day game in 1959
column17: Monday morning ’s contest will not be in held in conjunction with the Marathon
column18: which was moved to Oct. 11 due to the state ’s limits on crowds because of the pandemic . 	 THROW OUT THE NUMBERS 	 Cora had a simple explanation
column19: joking why left - hander Martín Pérez was starting the second game . 	 “ We dig into analytics and sabermetrics and all that
column20: we found out that Martín is actually not a morning person
column21: so we decided to go with Tanner
column23: smiling . “ I can tell . We had a lot of day games . You did n’t see him walking around the clubhouse a lot . ” 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 White Sox : La Russa said Anderson would get the second game off because “ he was on the bases so much . ” Anderson said : “ I want to play . I did my homework on the pitcher because I thought he was pitching the first game . ” 	 Red Sox : Regular catcher Christian Vázquez had his second straight game off . ... Houck was hit on the lower body by Anderson ’s grounder for a single in the fifth . He seemed OK but was pulled for a lefty - lefty matchup . 	 UP NEXT 	 Pérez ( 0 - 0
column24: 4.50 ERA ) gets the ball in the nightcap . La Russa said RHP Michael Kopech ( 1 - 0
column25: 1.17 ) would start the second game . He was a highly - touted prospect with the Red Sox before being dealt in a trade for Chris Sale in 2016 . 	 ------ 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: CINCINNATI -- — If Shane Bieber felt a bit off at the start
column2: it sure did n't show . 	 Bieber kept up his record strikeout run
column3: fanning 13 and pitching the Cleveland Indians past the Cincinnati Reds 6 - 3 on Sunday . 	 Bieber ( 2 - 1 ) became the first pitcher in big league history to begin the season with four straight starts with at least 10 strikeouts . 	 The AL Cy Young Award winner has 48 strikeouts this year
column4: matching Hall of Famer Nolan Ryan for the most through the first four starts of a season . Bieber has fanned at least eight in a 16 straight starts
column5: one short of Randy Johnson ’s major league mark . 	 “ I felt a little slow
column6: a little sluggish at the beginning of the game but was able to get through it and kind of get on a roll there at the end
column7: ” Bieber said . 	 Bieber struck out the side in the seventh . He wrapped up his outing by fanning three more in the eighth around a solo home run by former teammate Tyler Naquin . 	 After being routed on Friday night and then losing in the 10th inning Saturday when an error with two outs in the ninth allowed the Reds to extend the game
column8: Cleveland manager Terry Francona was happy to be able to give the ball to Bieber on Sunday . 	 “ That ’s why you call guys aces . And he certainly has lived up to that
column9: " Francona said . " He ’s really accountable for what he needs to do . It ’s nice
column10: you got a tough night like you had last night
column11: and you see him running out to the bullpen . That makes you feel a little better . ” 	 Bieber allowed three runs and six hits with two walks . 	 “ He ’s the complete package as a pitcher
column12: " Reds manager David Bell said . " He has it all . He deserves all the credit today . We got a few runs off him but not enough . ” 	 Emmanuel Clase struck out the side in the ninth
column13: again hitting 100 mph with his heater . 	 The Indians hit three home runs
column15: to salvage a win in the all - Ohio series . 	 Roberto Pérez hit a three - run homer off Wade Miley ( 2 - 1 ) over the center field wall with two on in the fourth inning for a 4 - 0 lead . 	 José Ramírez launched a solo drive into the upper deck in the first . Jordan Luplow had a two - run homer in the seventh . 	 Wade Miley ( 2 - 1 ) took the loss for the Reds
column16: lasting five innings and striking out five . 	 QUOTABLE 	 “ We had some good at bats against ( Bieber )
column17: but he got out of trouble by making really good pitches
column18: ” Reds left fielder Jesse Winker said . “ My last at - bat against him ( in the seventh inning )
column19: he made some unbelievable pitches . He ’s a Cy Young winner for sure . ” 	 JOLTIN ' JOEY 	 Joey Votto had three hits
column20: including a two - run double in the Reds fifth . Votto was 7 for 11 in the weekend series
column21: hitting a homer on Friday night and starting a triple play in the Reds ' come - from - behind win on Saturday . He raised his batting average to .267 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Reds 3B Mike Moustakas missed his third straight game with a non - COVID illness . Kyle Farmer started in his place . OF Shogo Akiyama ( hamstring ) is back with the team
column22: but it not expected to play until at least May. 	 UP NEXT 	 Indians : After an off day
column23: open a nine - game homestand Tuesday with a pair against the White Sox . The teams split a four - game series last week in Chicago . Cleveland sends RHP Zach Plesac against LHP Carlos Rodón
column24: who threw a no - hitter against them in an 8 - 0 White Sox win Wednesday . 	 Reds : After an off day

column26: who took two out of three from the Reds in a series earlier this month in Phoenix . Castillo struck out seven in a no - decision on Tuesday . Coming off the disabled list

column1: MIAMI -- — Several firsts by the Giants ’ pitching staff added up to a bunch of zeroes for the Marlins . 	 Alex Wood threw five innings   in his first start for San Francisco
column2: reliever Camilo Doval made a successful   major league debut and Tyler Rogers earned his first save   of the year as the Giants beat Miami 1 - 0 Sunday . 	 The Marlins totaled only three hits against five pitchers
column3: and the Giants averted a series sweep by scoring an unearned run in the third . 	 Wood ( 1 - 0 )
column4: returning from a back problem that sidelined him midway through spring training
column5: allowed three hits and walked none . The left - hander signed a $ 3 million
column6: one - year contract after pitching for the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2020 . 	 “ I felt really good
column7: ” he said . “ It was a really good start . Any time there are zeroes on the board
column8: no matter how you get there
column9: that ’s always a positive . ” 	 With the Giants ' bullpen depleted by a 10 - inning loss Saturday night
column10: they called on Doval in the seventh . The rookie pitched a perfect inning against the heart of the order
column11: striking out Jesús Aguilar and Adam Duvall . 	 “ It ’s not the easiest task
column12: but he stepped up and met the challenge
column13: ” manager Gabe Kapler said . “ The athlete came out . ” 	 With closer Jake McGee unavailable
column14: Rogers threw a perfect ninth for the Giants ' third shutout in their past seven games . 	 McGee blew a save Saturday
column15: possibly because he was feeling lingering effects from the COVID-19 vaccine . He went on the injured list Sunday but is n't expected to be sidelined long . 	 The Giants retired the last 13 batters . 	 Miami also lost center fielder Starling Marte
column16: who tweaked his oblique batting with two out in the ninth . Jorge Alfaro replaced him and grounded out to end the game . 	 “ It is something Starling just felt
column17: ” Marlins manager Don Mattingly said . " One thing we did n’t want him to do is take another swing and do more damage
column18: if there is any . ” 	 Pablo López ( 0 - 2 ) totaled a career - high nine strikeouts in six innings but allowed the unearned run . The Giants had a runner at first when Aguilar failed to glove a two - out grounder at first base for an error
column19: and Alex Dickerson followed   with an RBI single . 	 Miami totaled only four baserunners and lost two of them . Miguel Rojas was picked off second base in the first inning
column20: and Jazz Chisholm Jr. was out trying to stretch a hit into a double in the fifth . 	 “ It was one of those days that they seemed to be better than us
column21: " Mattingly said . “ We took a couple of opportunities away . ” 	 WEB GEM 	 Giants center fielder Austin Slater made a diving catch   to rob López of an extra - base hit . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Giants : C Buster Posey ( bruised left elbow ) had some swelling less than 24 hours after being hit by a pitch from Sandy Alcantara
column22: but it was better after the game
column23: Kapler said . X - rays were negative . 	 RETURNING TO PHILLY 	 The Giants begin a three - game series Monday in Philadelphia where Kapler was fired in 2019 after two seasons with the Phillies . 	 “ I did the best job I could every day
column24: ” Kapler said . “ It did n’t work out . We did n’t win enough . That ultimately is the bottom line . ” 	 What sort of reception does he expect from the Phillies ’ notoriously unforgiving fans ? 	 “ Making that prediction
column25: I just do n’t know where to begin
column26: ” Kapler said . 	 BIG LEAGUE GREETING 	 Doval said that when he struck out Aguilar to start the seventh
column27: the slugger startled him with a profanity . 	 “ I said
column28: ‘ Wow
column29: is that how things are going to be up here ? ’ ” the Dominican said with a laugh . 	 UP NEXT 	 Giants : RHP Kevin Gausman ( 0 - 0

column1: MILWAUKEE -- — Colin Moran hit an early three - run homer
column2: then had an RBI double in the 10th inning that sent the Pittsburgh Pirates over the Milwaukee Brewers 6 - 5 on Sunday . 	 The Pirates withstood a two - homer performance from the Brewers ' Daniel Vogelbach to earn their first series win in Milwaukee since September 2018 . Pittsburgh has won two of three in each of its last three series to recover from an early six - game skid . 	 Pittsburgh 's Bryan Reynolds and Milwaukee 's Avisaíl García also homered . 	 “ Obviously it 's great to win series
column4: who scored the go - ahead run . “ We had a rough start . To answer back the way we have
column5: speaks volumes for who we are as a team . We 'll just keep it going . " 	 The Pirates were 2 - 11 in Milwaukee from 2019 - 20 . 	 Moran hit a leadoff double off J.P. Feyereisen ( 0 - 1 ) in the 10th to bring home Reynolds from second base . 	 Richard Rodríguez ( 1 - 0 ) earned the win with two innings of perfect relief . 	 Rodríguez has allowed one hit
column6: one walk and no runs in 6 1/3 innings this season . Pirates manager Derek Shelton felt comfortable giving Rodríguez a second inning in part because the right - hander had n't pitched since Tuesday . 	 “ If you watch Richie Rodríguez at all
column8: I do n't know if he has a pulse
column10: if you ask him to throw four innings every day
column11: he would do it . ” 	 With Jackie Bradley Jr. on second to start the bottom of the 10th
column12: Rodríguez retired Vogelbach and Garcia on a pair of flyballs before striking out Travis Shaw to seal the victory . 	 “ I was able to get into some good counts today and put some good swings on it
column13: ” Vogelbach said . “ I wish I had that last at - bat back
column14: being able to get the guy over and give us a chance to tie the game
column15: and I was n’t able to do that . So
column16: that ’s frustrating for myself . ” 	 This back - and - forth game featured two - run homers from each team in the seventh . 	 Reynolds hit a 3 - 2 pitch from Brad Boxberger into the back rows of the second deck of the right - field stands to break a 3 - all tie in the top half of the inning . Reynolds ’ 436 - foot drive also scored Adam Frazier
column17: who had led off the inning with a bloop single . 	 The Brewers tied it back up in the bottom of the seventh . After Bradley reached on a one - out bunt single
column18: Vogelbach homered off Chris Stratton . 	 Pittsburgh ’s bullpen had thrown 11 1/3 straight scoreless innings and had allowed just one run in its last 25 innings before Vogelbach ’s drive . 	 Vogelbach also had a solo homer   that helped the Brewers take a 2 - 0 lead in the first . Moran ’s three - run homer   in the top of the third put the Pirates in front
column19: but   García tied it with a solo shot in the bottom of the third . 	 Pittsburgh has now won all eight of Chad Kuhl ’s career starts against the Brewers . 	 Kuhl entered the day with a 4 - 0 career record and 1.73 ERA against the Brewers . He was n’t quite as sharp Sunday as each of the two starting pitchers – Kuhl and Milwaukee ’s Freddy Peralta – allowed three runs over five innings . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Pirates : RHP Cody Ponce was reinstated from the injured list and optioned to the Pirates ’ alternate training site in Altoona
column20: Pennsylvania . 	 Brewers : Hitting coach Andy Haines acknowledged OF Christian Yelich is frustrated to be missing this much time early in the season . Yelich went on the injured list Saturday and has missed six straight games with a lower back strain . 	 “ Christian ’s a guy that takes so much pride in playing every day
column21: ” Haines said . “ He does not want to sit . He just never wants a day off . He knows the responsibility he has to people paying to watch him play and to the organization . ” 	 UP NEXT 	 The Pirates are off Monday before opening a three - game series at Detroit on Tuesday . Scheduled starters are LHP Tyler Anderson ( 1 - 2

column2: Mo. -- — Salvador Perez tapped his bat twice on the plate to make sure it was n't cracked
column3: then sent the next pitch he saw from Toronto reliever T.J. Zeuch into the left - field fountains
column4: breaking open a scoreless game and sending the Kansas City Royals to a 2 - 0 victory over the Blue Jays on Sunday . 	 Brady Singer kept the Blue Jays off the board through six innings . Kyle Zimmer ( 1 - 0 ) and Josh Staumont each worked a perfect inning
column5: and Greg Holland finished off the two - hitter for his second save of the season . 	 Kansas City has won a major league - leading 55 consecutive games when ahead after seven innings . 	 “ Well
column6: we can start by talking about Salvy again
column8: " because he just continues to amaze us . Our fans love him and he keeps doing things to make them love him more . Just so fun to watch . ” 	 Perez ’s two - run shot off Zeuch ( 0 - 2 ) in the seventh inning came one day after his two - out
column9: walk - off homer gave the Royals a 3 - 2 win and split of their doubleheader . That homer soared an estimated 459 feet
column10: the one Sunday a mere 441 . 	 Kansas City also won the opener Thursday night to take a series from Toronto for the first time since September 2017 . 	 “ That shutout to me
column11: just giving up a couple hits — there ’s a lot of pride that catchers take
column14: “ and I know Salvy takes a lot of pride in how that game unfolds . But they all did a terrific job . ” 	 The Royals won while leaving 13 on base
column15: and the teams combined to go 1 for 18 with runners in scoring position . 	 “ We 're just showing up and trying to do our best
column16: ” said Perez

column18: 000th hit and a walk - off pickoff against Los Angeles the very next night . 	 “ It was a great week
column19: " Perez admitted with a smile
column20: “ and hopefully we can continue to do it . ” 	 Sunday 's game was scoreless through six
column21: but it was n't so much a pitcher 's duel as an exercise in offensive ineptitude . 	 The Royals used a pair of walks each of the first two innings to load the bases against Robbie Ray
column22: but each time he left them that way . They worked two more walks in the third and stranded those runners
column23: and left runners standing on second base each of the next two innings to run their total to 10 through five . 	 Singer must be wondering whether his teammates like him . 	 The Royals did not score a single run with him on the mound in his first two starts
column24: and they failed to again despite a solid job against the Blue Jays . Singer allowed just two hits and walked three while striking out six . 	 At least he rendered the Blue Jays equally ineffective with runners on base . They left two aboard in the second
column25: runners on the corners in the third and two more in the fourth
column26: keeping the game scoreless even with busy base paths . 	 “ I feel good where we are as a team with all the injuries
column27: ” Blue Jays manager Charlie Montoyo said . “ Guys are playing now that were n't supposed to play
column28: and that 's how it goes . Maybe some guys are putting more pressure on themselves because now the lineup 's not as strong as it used to be
column29: but that 's how it goes . ” 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Blue Jays RHP Jordan Romano ( elbow ) threw a side session and could return when his 10 - day IL stint is up April 24
