column2: Texas -- — Nate Lowe singled with two outs and the bases loaded in the 10th inning
column3: giving the Texas Rangers a 1 - 0 victory over the Baltimore Orioles on Sunday in a pitcher 's duel between a pair of opening day starters . 	 The hit ended a five - game home losing streak for the Rangers and capped a wild extra frame that looked it would start with a lead for the Orioles
column4: who dropped to 6 - 3 on the road . 	 In the top of the 10th
column5: with automatic runner Maikel Franco on third base and one out
column6: pinch - hitter Trey Mancini lined a one - hopper in front of right fielder Adolis García . 	 Franco
column8: held up near third to make sure the ball fell in and was thrown out at home when Jose Trevino caught García 's one - hop throw just up the line . The Texas catcher collided with Franco almost immediately while staying on his feet . 	 Franco held his right arm after tumbled to the ground . 	 “ If you 're afraid of contact
column9: find another position other than catcher
column10: ” Trevino said . “ I played football in high school . It was an accidental collision at the plate
column11: spur of the moment thing . He 's a big dude
column12: but I stayed on my feet . ” 	 Baltimore manager Brandon Hyde had a lengthy discussion with plate umpire Sam Holbrook
column13: and the crew met briefly before play resumed without a replay . Hyde said he wanted the umpires to look at the play . Mancini was credited with a single . 	 The Baltimore 10th started with Willie Calhoun
column14: who took over in left field after pinch - hitting for Texas
column15: making a diving catch in left - center on a liner by Ryan Mountcastle . Calhoun also had one of the walks in the Texas 10th . 	 “ They played great defense in that top of the 10th
column16: the catch in left - center and then the play in right field
column17: ” Hyde said . “ Tip your cap to them . ” 	 Franco made a nice tag at third for the first out of the Texas 10th with Eli White trying to bunt automatic runner Charlie Culberson to third . 	 After two walks on either side of a strikeout loaded the bases
column18: Lowe stopped a 5 - for-39 slide by grounding a single to left against the shift off Travis Lakins Sr . ( 1 - 1 )
column19: ending a stretch of 13 2/3 scoreless innings for the Baltimore bullpen . 	 “ Just get the run across no matter what it took
column20: ” Lowe said after his team - leading 16th RBI . “ He goes to his breaking ball a lot
column21: so if he 's going to hit you in your foot
column22: you take the win no matter what . Getting something over the dish and getting the bat on it was the only thing that mattered . ” 	 John King ( 1 - 0 ) pitched a scoreless 10th for the Rangers . 	 When he started the top of the 10th at second base
column23: Franco was just the fifth runner to get that far in a game dominated by Texas ' Kyle Gibson and Baltimore 's John Means . 	 Gibson allowed four hits in eight scoreless innings
column24: striking out six without a walk in the right - hander 's third consecutive strong outing since the shortest opening day start in franchise history . 	 The first four outs for Means were strikeouts
column25: and the left - hander finished with nine Ks and two walks while tossing seven scoreless innings for the second time this season . Means limited Boston to one hit in the opener . 	 Trevino was the first runner to reach third base in the game with one out in the fifth inning after a leadoff double . But Means struck out Leody Taveras and got Isiah Kiner - Falefa on a flyout . 	 GIBSON 'S REBOUND 	 Gibson
column26: who gave up five runs while getting just one out in the opener after taking the mound with a 5 - 0 lead at Kansas City
column27: did n’t allow a runner past second base while extending his home scoreless streak to 20 innings going back to last season . He has allowed one earned run in 21 innings since the opener . 	 “ We saw it all spring
column28: ” manager Chris Woodward said . “ We 've seen it in everything he 's done up until that opening day start . For whatever reason it was n't synced up that day . Since then
column29: he 's obviously clearly the reason why he 's our No . 1 pitcher . ” 	 O 'S ROSTER MOVE 	 Baltimore right - hander Dean Kremer was sent to the alternate site a day after a solid start in a 6 - 1 win over the Rangers that followed two rough outings . Reliever Cole Sulser was recalled from the alternate site . Hyde said the Orioles made the move because they only need four starters this week with two days off . 	 GALLO 'S DAY OFF 	 Texas slugger Joey Gallo
column30: who reached base in each of the first 15 games
column31: was out of the lineup for the first time with the lefty - lefty matchup against Means . Woodward said he never considered using the powerful lefty late in the game because he wanted to give Gallo a full day off . 	 UP NEXT 	 Orioles : RHP Matt Harvey ( 0 - 1
column32: 5.02 ERA ) is set to start the opener of a two - game series in Miami on Tuesday . Harvey gave up two runs on three hits in a no - decision against Seattle in his previous start . The three hits were the fewest he 's allowed since April 2019 . 	 Rangers : RHP Kohei Arihara ( 1 - 1
column33: 3.07 ERA ) is set for the opener of a three - game series at the Angels on Monday night . LA is the first AL West opponent of the season 	 for the Rangers . column1: DENVER -- — Marcus Stroman pitched eight innings of one - run ball and made a dazzling defensive play
column2: catcher James McCann threw out Trevor Story attempting to steal second for the final out and the New York Mets beat the Colorado Rockies 2 - 1 on Sunday . 	 J.D. Davis delivered an RBI single and Jeff McNeil had an RBI groundout for the Mets
column3: who have won five of their last six
column4: including two of three at Coors Field this weekend . 	 Stroman ( 3 - 0 ) allowed three hits and struck out five . He also helped himself with a spectacular backhand play to start the eighth . 	 The nimble right - hander shuffled quickly off the mound to his right and reached behind his back with his glove to snag Josh Fuentes ’ grounder . He threw off - balanced to first
column5: and the ball rolled the final few feet into Pete Alonso ’s glove just before Fuentes got to the base . 	 “ It was all reaction
column7: ” Stroman said . “ I work in the weight room to keep my athleticism and when I ’m out there
column8: I just kind of let everything flow . I thought I was going to catch it . I did n’t know and once I felt it in my hand
column9: I already had my momentum going toward third . 	 " And I figured rather than just stopping and planting
column10: I figure just get it over there as quick as possible . It worked out perfectly
column11: and ( Alonso ) made a great stretch to get him . ” 	 New York has had to overcome a series of interruptions this season
column12: including seven postponements due to weather and coronavirus protocols . 	 “ Pitching and defense
column13: you do those two things well and you ’re going to be able to win a lot of games . ” Mets manager Luis Rojas said . “ I think we ’re doing it well for the most part right now . But I think the more games we ’ll play and the more we ’re able to get out there
column15: the guys are going to be playing better and better . ” 	 Charlie Blackmon had an RBI single for the Rockies
column16: who have lost eight of nine . 	 Edwin Díaz earned his second save with a scoreless ninth
column17: getting the last out as Story was tagged out by shortstop Francisco Lindor on the throw to second from McCann . 	 “ Díaz is a tough at - bat
column18: ” Story said . “ I was trying to get into scoring position for ( Blackmon ) to where it would n’t take extra bases to score . I ’d do it again for sure . But McCann made a perfect throw and Lindor made a nice tag . ” 	 Raimel Tapia singled off Stroman to start the bottom of the first
column19: but the Mets pitcher induced a double - play grounder from the next batter
column21: and a popup from Story . He set the side down in order in four of the next five innings before Story doubled with one out in the seventh . 	 Blackmon followed with an RBI single
column22: ending a streak of 14 2/3 innings in which Stroman had not allowed a run . Stroman limited the damage by closing out the seventh with strikeouts of C.J. Cron and Garrett Hampson . 	 Antonio Senzatela ( 1 - 3 )
column23: who beat the Mets in his two previous starts against them
column24: had another strong outing . He went six innings and gave up two runs on five hits . He struck out four and walked none . 	 CLOSE PLAY 	 McNeil was narrowly thrown out in the top of the ninth inning trying to stretch a double into a triple . He drove a ball off Daniel Bard into the right field corner
column25: where Blackmon scooped it up and relayed to second baseman McMahon before getting the ball to third
column26: where Fuentes applied the tag . The call was confirmed by replay review . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Rockies : INF Chris Owings has been transferred to the 60 - day injured list from the 10 - day IL . Owings has n’t played since injuring his left thumb on a swing in which he tripled as a pinch - hitter against the San Francisco Giants on April 9 . In another move
column27: the Rockies claimed RHP Ashton Goudeau off waivers from the Los Angeles Dodgers . Goudeau was then optioned to the Rockies ’ alternate training site . 	 UP NEXT 	 Mets : After a day off Monday

column2: Calif. -- — Matt Olson scored from second base on a fielding error by Detroit third baseman Jeimer Candelario with two outs in the ninth inning
column3: rallying the Oakland Athletics past the Tigers 3 - 2 on Sunday for their eighth straight win . 	 Sean Murphy hit a tying home run in the eighth as the A ’s swept the four - game series . 	 “ We feel pretty good about the way we ’re playing right now
column4: ” A ’s manager Bob Melvin said . “ We were n’t getting a ton of good swings
column5: but as long as we ’re close we feel like we find a way to win the game . " 	 Olson hit a one - out double off Gregory Soto ( 1 - 0 ) when Tigers center fielder Victor Reyes lost a high fly ball in the sun . After Matt Chapman struck out looking
column6: Murphy walked before pinch - hitter Mitch Moreland hit a sharp grounder that rolled under Candelario ’s glove into left field . 	 “ Everything that kind of could go wrong did go wrong in this four - game series
column7: ” Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said . “ We did n’t hit and then ultimately we just could n’t finish them all off . I thought today was a breakthrough day for us early and then ultimately they did more than we did to win . ” 	 Ramón Laureano had an RBI triple for the A ’s . 	 The A ’s are 9 - 1 since starting the season 0 - 6 . 	 “ Everybody ’s kind of rolling right now
column9: who had a walkoff single to beat the Dodgers on April 7 . “ We feel good as a group . Seems we ’re playing good baseball on all sides of it . ” 	 Harold Castro had three hits for the Tigers
column10: including a two - run single in the sixth that snapped Detroit ’s 23 - inning scoreless streak . 	 The Tigers have lost four straight after sweeping three from the Astros in Houston . 	 “ Just how it happens
column11: ” starting pitcher Matthew Boyd said . “ I would n’t say it ’s any sort of luck or anything like that . I had an opportunity to close out the eighth inning and gave up a run . ” 	 Lou Trivino ( 1 - 0 ) retired three batters for the win . 	 STRONG STARTS 	 Both starters pitched effectively but left with no - decisions . 	 Detroit ’s Boyd gave up four hits and two runs in 7 1/3 innings . Murphy ’s home run was the first off Boyd this season after the lefty allowed an AL - leading 15 in the shortened 2020 season . 	 A ’s starter Chris Bassitt struck out a season - high eight in six innings and allowed five hits and two runs . 	 ESCAPE ACT 	 Bassitt pitched himself into trouble in the first but wriggled out of the jam with a little luck . After Tigers leadoff man Robbie Grossman walked and Candelario singled
column12: Willi Castro lofted a short fly that fell in front of A ’s center fielder Laureano . Laureano alertly threw to third to nail Grossman
column13: who had paused to see if the ball would drop . Wilson Ramos singled to load the bases but Bassitt retired Renato Núñez on a popup then fanned Harold Castro on three pitches . 	 “ I was trying to pitch a little bit too much in the first and hit spots instead of going right at them
column14: ” Bassitt said . 	 MELVIN ’S MILESTONE 	 The game marked the 1
column15: 471st for Melvin as manager of the A ’s
column16: tying current White Sox skipper Tony La Russa for second most in Oakland history . Connie Mack holds the franchise record with 7
column17: 396 . “ It means I ’ve dodged a few bullets along the way and remained in place
column18: ” said Melvin
column19: whose 776 wins are 22 fewer than La Russa ’s . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Tigers : RHP Spencer Turnbull threw a bullpen at the Tigers’Triple - A facility in Toledo and is scheduled to come off the IL to pitch against Pittsburgh on Wednesday . Turnbull has been on the COVID-19 list since March 29 . 	 Athletics : OF Stephen Piscotty is due to come off the paternity list Monday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Tigers : Following a day off
column20: RHP Michael Fullmer ( 1 - 0 . 3.00 ERA ) faces the Pittsburgh Pirates on Tuesday to begin a seven - game homestand . column1: SEATTLE -- — Ty France hit a two - run home run
column2: six Seattle pitchers combined on a one - hitter and the Mariners beat the depleted Houston Astros 7 - 2 on Sunday . 	 France followed Mitch Haniger ’s two - run triple with a two - run home run to left field in the decisive four - run fifth inning to give the Mariners the series . Seattle has won four of five and has come from behind in six of 10 victories . 	 Haniger and France
column3: who bat first and second in the lineup
column4: also had back - to - back RBI doubles in the seventh inning . France has reached base safely in 14 of 16 games and said having Haniger batting before him has made his life easier . 	 “ Guys do n't want to pitch to Mitch
column5: so hopefully they 'll pitch to me
column6: " France said . " We ’re feeding off each other well right now . ” 	 The loss was Houston ’s seventh in its last eight games and comes with five players — including four starters — still on the injured list due to COVID-19 concerns . 	 “ We made some mistakes in the heart of the plate and they did n’t miss them
column7: ” Houston manager Dusty Baker said . 	 Seattle starter Nick Margevicius left in the top of the fifth with a 3 - 1 count to Chas McCormick due to fatigue trailing 2 - 1 after giving up one hit and one unearned run while striking out three . LJay Newsome ( 1 - 0 )
column10: Rafael Montero and Drew Steckenrider combined for five innings of hitless relief . 	 The Mariners bullpen is 6 - 1 with five saves in the last 11 games
column11: giving up just six earned runs in 35 2/3 innings . 	 “ I believe we threw 16 of 16 first - pitch strikes after LJay came in and the first guy walked
column12: " Servais said . " It was pretty impressive when you talk about dominating the zone and getting ahead in the count . You ca n’t do any better than that . ” 	 Houston starter Jake Odorizzi ( 0 - 2 ) struck out seven and walked three in 4 1/3 innings . He gave up three hits but was pulled after Haniger ’s fifth - inning triple made it 3 - 2 . Aledmys Díaz had Houston ’s only hit
column13: an RBI double in the second inning that fell in when outfielder José Marmolejos lost the ball in the sun . 	 “ It 's tough to take when you only got one hit and the one hit we got was lost in the sun
column14: ” Baker said . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Astros : Baker said 2B Jose Altuve
column15: DH Yordan Alvarez
column16: 3B Alex Bregman
column17: IF Robel Garcia and C Martin Maldonado have been cleared for individual workouts after sitting out since last Wednesday due to COVID-19 safety protocols . “ Run
column18: throw
column19: hit
column21: ” Baker said . “ It ’s a little tough . I mean right now they have to work out individually

column1: SAN DIEGO -- — Round 1 is in the books
column2: and the heavyweight Padres and Dodgers did n't disappoint . 	 “ I think it was no secret that the whole baseball world was locked into this series
column3: " San Diego slugger Eric Hosmer said . “ Everybody enjoyed the matchup . ” 	 Hosmer delivered the tying and go - ahead RBI in the seventh and eighth innings
column4: helping the Padres beat Los Angeles 5 - 2 Sunday to avoid a sweep in the first series of the year between the NL West rivals . The Dodgers won the opener Friday in 12 innings and took Saturday 's matchup 2 - 0 thanks to a game - ending
column5: diving grab by center fielder Mookie Betts . 	 “ It is a good preview for many more games to come . Both teams are playing with a ton of energy " Padres manager Jayce Tingler said . “ We were hoping to win the series
column7: Dodgers starter Trevor Bauer handed off a 2 - 1 lead to Los Angeles ' bullpen after six innings in a tight duel with another Cy Young Award winner
column8: Blake Snell . 	 Hosmer doubled in the tying run in the seventh off Brusdar Graterol
column9: then delivered the decisive blow in the eighth . San Diego scored three unearned runs in the inning stemming from shortstop Corey Seager 's throwing error . Hosmer 's sharp single made it 3 - 2
column10: and Tommy Pham followed with a two - run double into the left - field corner . 	 San Diego had lost seven straight in the rivalry
column11: including a three - game sweep in last year 's NL Division Series . The Padres and Dodgers will meet 16 more times this season
column12: starting with a set next weekend in Los Angeles . 	 “ We have always felt that we have been in all of these games and we are right there so it was nice today to get over that hump and be on the right side of this one
column13: ” Hosmer said . 	 In four previous career starts versus the Padres
column14: Bauer was 0 - 4 with a 5.06 ERA . Bauer
column15: the 2020 NL Cy Young winner with Cincinnati
column16: was effective his entire outing
column17: pounding his chest twice after striking out Fernando Tatis Jr. on a 3 - 2 fastball to end the sixth and finish his day . Bauer gave up one earned run and three hits while striking out seven . 	 Snell
column18: the 2018 AL Cy Young winner with Tampa Bay
column19: faced the Dodgers for the first time since he was fatefully taken out of Game 6 of the World Series last year after dominating LA for over five innings . He lasted five innings and was lifted for a pinch - hitter after 95 pitches
column20: giving up two earned runs and two hits while striking out seven on 98 pitches . 	 “ I 'm happy to get this start out of the way so I do n't have to watch Game 6 37
column21: 000 times a day — I am kind of over that
column22: " Snell said . “ I 'm happy that the boys were able to come back and get a win . " 	 Keone Kela ( 2 - 0 ) earned the win in relief for the Padres and Mark Melancon notched his sixth save . Reliever Scott Alexander ( 0 - 1 ) took the loss for the Dodgers . 	 Graterol
column23: activated on Sunday from the 10 - day injured list
column24: faced the Padres in the seventh and gave up a single
column25: double and walk in five batters in two - thirds of an inning . Hosmer 's opposite - field double off the left - field foul line scored Manny Machado . 	 In the second inning
column26: Will Smith singled and Chris Taylor smashed an estimated 443 - foot
column27: two - run homer to left - center on a 95 mph fastball from Snell to give the Dodgers a 2 - 0 edge . 	 “ The home run to Taylor was a good pitch
column28: he just ambushed the fastball
column29: " Snell said . “ I just need to get my pitches in the zone a lot better . " 	 The Padres trailed only 2 - 1 after Jake Cronenworth hit a curveball from Bauer for a solo homer in the fourth . 	 Graterol pitched for the first time since his celebration on the mound in last year ’s NL Division Series after teammate Cody Bellinger ’s sensational catch robbing Tatis of a home run in Game 2 . Graterol 's antics angered the Padres and led to a heated confrontation between the teams . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Dodgers : Placed SS Gavin Lux on the 10 - day injured list with right wrist soreness . 	 Padres : RF Trent Grisham was scratched from Sunday ’s starting lineup due to left quad tightness but was available on the bench . 	 UP NEXT 	 Dodgers : RHP Dustin May ( 1 - 0

column1: BOSTON -- — Yermín Mercedes opened Chicago ’s three - run fourth inning with a long homer
column2: and the White Sox completed a sweep of their split - admission doubleheader against the Boston Red Sox on Sunday with a 5 - 1 victory . 	 Nick Madrigal had two hits and drove in two runs for Chicago
column3: which climbed back to .500 at 8 - 8 . 	 In the opener

column9: which was moved to Oct. 11 due to the state ’s limits on crowds because of the pandemic . 	 J.D. Martinez had an RBI single for Boston ’s lone run in the second game . 	 Back wearing their traditional white uniforms with red letters and numbers in the nightcap

column16: we 're going to have a really good bullpen
column17: ” La Russa said . 	 The Red Sox were held to four hits in the nightcap . 	 “ Stuff - wise
column18: it 's one of the toughest staffs in the big leagues
column19: ” Boston manager Alex Cora said . “ They 've got velo and secondary pitches . They were good . ” 	 Pérez was tagged for four runs and seven hits in 3 2/3 innings . 	 The Red Sox wore their yellow - and - blue City Series uniforms in the first game for the second straight day
column20: honoring the Marathon with the colors that stretch across the finish line of the famous race . 	 Yasmani Grandal had an RBI double and Yoán Moncada drove in a run with a single for the White Sox . Keuchel ( 1 - 0 ) gave up two runs and Hendriks got his second save . 	 “ Obviously
column21: going in the first game

column23: I was able to have a little better location
column24: a little better feel . ” 	 Anderson sent a 96.8 mph fastball from Tanner Houck ( 0 - 2 ) into Boston ’s bullpen . 	 Kiké Hernández homered around the right - field foul pole for Boston . column28: ” Cora said

column1: CHICAGO -- — The Atlanta Braves say it 's next man up when it comes to their rash of injuries so far this season . 	 They might need a few men to step up if Ronald Acuña Jr. has to go on the injured list . 	 Acuña 's abdominal strain cast a shadow over Atlanta 's 13 - 4 victory over the Chicago Cubs on Sunday night
column2: even after the Braves bashed four homers in the first inning against Kyle Hendricks . 	 Freddie Freeman
column4: Ehire Adrianza and Guillermo Heredia connected during Atlanta 's fast start
column5: and Heredia added his first career grand slam in the sixth for his first multihomer game . But the Braves ' big concern after the win was the status of Acuña
column6: who departed in the fourth after he got banged up during a tough trip around the bases . 	 “ He 's got an abdominal strain
column8: ” manager Brian Snitker said . 	 Snitker said he is n't sure if Acuña is going to need a stint on the IL . 	 “ It was so late here that they could n't get the test that they wanted
column9: so they 'll get it tomorrow in New York and
column12: ” he said . 	 The loss of Acuña for any significant chunk of time would be a tough blow for Atlanta
column13: which has been hit hard by injuries . The dynamic outfielder began the day with a .433 batting average
column15: 16 RBI and 20 runs scored . 	 Heredia finished with a career - high six RBI
column16: and d’Arnaud drove in three runs . Bryse Wilson ( 1 - 0 ) pitched five innings of three - run ball in his first appearance of the season . 	 Anthony Rizzo hit two solo drives for Chicago
column17: which lost for the sixth time in eight games . It was Rizzo 's first multihomer game since Aug. 29 at Cincinnati and No . 19 for his career . 	 “ Their lineup is deep with a lot of thump
column18: ” Rizzo said
column19: “ and just tonight was n't Kyle 's night in the first . ” 	 The Cubs bashed six homers during Saturday 's 13 - 4 victory
column20: but it was the Braves showing off their power in the rubber game of the weekend set . 	 “ As far as the result yesterday
column21: you know obviously it was n't ideal . It was n't what we wanted
column22: ” Heredia said through a translator . “ But it 's one of those things where you kind of put it behind you and you come out looking to the next day to kind of have the game that we put together . ” 	 Freeman kicked it off with a one - out solo drive that cleared the bleachers in right for his fifth homer
column23: traveling an estimated 421 feet . D'Arnaud connected for a two - run shot
column24: Adrianza belted a solo homer and Heredia capped Atlanta 's six - run first with another two - run drive . 	 The Braves hit four homers in the first inning for the first time since May 28
column26: against Cincinnati . The Cubs allowed four homers in an inning for the first time since the seventh on July 4
column28: against the Reds . 	 Hendricks ( 0 - 2 ) was tagged for seven runs and seven hits in four innings in his first start since April 7 . The right - hander was slated to pitch Tuesday at Milwaukee
column29: but he was scratched because of an illness . 	 “ Just not very good overall from the start
column30: ” Hendricks said . “ Not aggressive
column31: falling behind guys and then just everything was flat . ” 	 NOT BAD AT ALL 	 Heredia was 0 for 7 in three games this season before busting out against the Cubs . According to STATS
column32: he became the first player to drive in at least six runs in a game from the No . 8 spot in the Braves ' lineup since RBI became an official stat in 1920 . column1: BOSTON -- — Kiké Hernández led off with a replay - aided home run and Bobby Dalbec worked a 14 - pitch walk in a six - run first inning
column2: helping the Red Sox beat the Chicago White Sox 11 - 4 on Monday in the first Patriots ’ Day game played apart from the Boston Marathon . 	 The Marathon was moved to Oct. 11 because of Massachusetts limits on crowds during the novel coronavirus pandemic . The Patriots ' Day game
column3: with a start shortly after 11 a.m.
column4: has been played by the Red Sox since 1959 . It drew a limited crowd of 4
column5: 738 . 	 “ Probably the best inning of this short season . Line drive after line drive
column6: quality at - bat after quality at - bat
column7: “ Red Sox manager Alex Cora said . ” We had good at - bats against a good pitcher
column8: one of the best in the league . It was fun to see . " 	 Lucas Giolito ( 1 - 1 ) was removed with two on and no outs in the second . He allowed eight runs — seven earned — and eight hits as his ERA more than doubled from 2.55 to 5.79 . 	 “ I lost us the game in the first inning
column9: and its not a good feeling
column10: ” Giolito said . “ I think that they had a good approach against me
column11: and I pitched into it and they did n't miss . ” 	 Nathan Eovaldi ( 3 - 1 ) matched his career - high with 10 strikeouts in 6 1/3 innings
column12: allowing four runs and nine hits with no walks . 	 “ Anytime we can keep score runs and put the pressure on those guys
column14: ” Eovaldi said . “ It 's a huge win for us
column15: especially after having the two losses ( Sunday ) . ” 	 J.D. Martinez had two RBI with a solo homer and single
column16: and Alex Verdugo hit a solo homer for Boston
column17: which split the four - game series . The Red Sox had lost three of four games following a nine - game winning streak . 	 Adam Eaton drove in three runs and had two doubles for Chicago ( 8 - 9 )
column18: which has not moved above .500 this season . 	 The Red Sox wore white uniforms with red letters that read “ Boston ” across the front
column19: which they ’ve worn on Patriots ’ Day since the first game back after the Marathon bombings in 2013 . 	 Boston 's first six batters got hits . 	 “ They got just about everything he threw
column20: ” White Sox manager Tony La Russa said . 	 Hernández hit a drive off the ledge just above the Green Monster . Following a 55 - second video review
column21: he took off on his home run trot after waiting at first base . 	 Rafael Devers
column22: Marwin González and Franchy Cordero each had an RBI single . 	 Dalbec fouled off eight pitches after he had two strikes before drawing the walk . 	 DIFFERENT FEELING 	 Bars and restaurants — nearly always packed with lines outside most
column24: by 9 a.m. — were steady but understandably slower . In previous years
column25: fans would head out early to catch some of the runners heading through nearby Kenmore Square and
column26: since Monster seats opened in 2003
column27: many atop the wall would turn and try to catch a glimpse of the leaders heading into Kenmore with helicopters flying overhead in the near distance . 	 INTERSTING CHOICE 	 La Russa brought DH Yermín Mercedes in to pitch down six runs in the seventh . He gave up a run . INF Danny Mendick worked a scoreless eighth
column28: striking out Cordero on a 63.7 mph curveball . He got Hernández to ground out on a 39.6 mph curve . 	 “ We 've got several that could have pitched in a competitive game
column29: but if they pitched today
column30: they 're out ( Tuesday )
column31: ” La Russa explained . 	 “ I pitched in Independent ball
column32: ” Mercedes said . “ Tony was the first guy that told me maybe I go an inning . ... I responded : ‘ I ’m ready . " 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 White Sox : La Russa said RHP Lance Lynn
column33: on the injured list with what the manager said was something a neck / shoulder issue
column34: will be examined . … SS Tim Anderson and RF Eaton were back in the lineup after getting the second game off Sunday . 	 Red Sox : 2B Christian Arroyo was out
column35: and Cora said Arroyo was banged up . … SS Xander Bogaerts got the day off . 	 UP NEXT 	 White Sox : LHP Carlos Rodón ( 2 - 0
column37: who threw a no - hitter at home in his previous start against the Indians

column1: WASHINGTON -- — Here 's how Paul DeJong explained the game plan the St. Louis Cardinals devised to face Washington 's Joe Ross for the second time in less than a week : " We just wanted
column3: to stay on the fastball . " 	 And here 's how Cardinals manager Mike Shildt described his hitters ' successful strategy : “ It ’s not a rocket science report . It ’s not overly earth - shattering . ” 	 No matter how you characterize it
column4: sure did work well . 	 DeJong hit two of the Cardinals ' five homers
column6: Tommy Edman and Paul Goldschmidt went deep back - to - back and St. Louis offered Jack Flaherty his usual strong run support in a 12 - 5 victory Monday night over Ross and the Nationals . 	 “ There ’s a lot of ways you can score
column7: ” Shildt said . “ The homer happened tonight . ” 	 Yes
column8: it did . 	 Five days after Ross befuddled the Cardinals with a steady set of sinkers and sliders in Washington 's 6 - 0 win
column9: St. Louis figured it needed to try something different . 	 The message — in the pregame meeting
column10: during conversations around the batting cage and in dugout chatter — essentially boiled down to : Do n't worry so much about the darting sliders and just focus on the fastballs . 	 “ We were just really disciplined today as a group ... not missing the ones we needed to hit
column12: calling the performance “ a validation of what we do . ” 	 He got the offense going by clanging a solo shot off the left - field foul pole in the second inning on a 95 mph sinker for the first run allowed by Ross ( 1 - 1 ) in three games this season after he sat out 2020 because of COVID-19 concerns . 	 DeJong ended Ross ' evening with another drive to left
column13: this one off a high fastball after Dylan Carlson was walked intentionally to load the bases
column14: making it 10 - 2 in the fifth . 	 Edman
column15: who hit a 3 - 0 pitch
column16: and Goldschmidt homered in the third off Ross
column17: whose season ERA went from 0.00 to 5.87 after he gave up 10 runs in 4 1/3 innings . Justin Williams added a shot off Ross ' replacement
column18: Kyle Finnegan . 	 When Shildt was asked before Monday ’s game about facing Ross again so soon
column19: he replied : “ I feel good about our plan . ” 	 Guess he was right . 	 Matt Carpenter
column20: who came in batting .069 and was dropped to seventh in the order
column21: provided an RBI single in the fourth as the Cardinals built a 6 - 0 lead with the help of Flaherty 's sacrifice bunt . 	 Flaherty ( 3 - 0 ) is used to that sort of cushion . The Cardinals are averaging 11 runs in his four starts this season — and 3.25 runs in the 12 games started by other pitchers . 	 He is now 14 - 0 when St. Louis scores at least five runs in one of his starts . 	 This time
column22: he went six innings and allowed five runs
column23: three earned . 	 “ Still got to treat it like it ’s a one - run
column25: ” Flaherty said . “ Things do n’t really change . It just becomes a mental game for you . ” 	 Washington dropped to 5 - 9 and here is a sign of where things stand for manager Dave Martinez at the moment : He turned to infielder Hernán Pérez to pitch the ninth
column26: his second appearance in a blowout loss against St. Louis in less than a week . 	 “ We have n’t had starters go deep
column27: ” Martinez said
column28: then turned his attention to his group of relievers : “ They 're getting taxed . They 're pitching way
column29: way too much . We definitely got to keep an eye on these guys or we wo n’t have a bullpen . ” 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cardinals : OF Tyler O’Neill ( right groin ) is expected to come off the 10 - day injured list for Friday 's start of a seven - game homestand . ... OF Harrison Bader ( right forearm ) planned to take batting practice on the field Monday and has been throwing from 120 feet for several days . 	 Nationals : LHP Luis Avilán
column31: decided to have Tommy John surgery after tearing his UCL
column32: Martinez said . Avilán went on the IL on Friday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Nationals lefty Patrick Corbin ( 0 - 2

column2: Mo. -- — Josh Fleming pitched two - hit ball into the sixth inning
column3: Kevin Kiermaier led a strong effort from the bottom of Tampa Bay 's batting order and the Rays beat the Kansas City Royals 4 - 1 Monday night . 	 Fleming ( 1 - 1 ) struck out three in 5 1/3 innings
column4: getting big cheers from friends and family who journeyed over from his hometown of Bridgeton
column5: Missouri . The 24 - year - old left - hander has allowed just one run in 10 1/3 innings this year . 	 “ I did n't hear them when I was pitching
column6: " Fleming said . " Once I got taken out
column7: I heard a big cheer . It was just awesome . ” 	 Relievers Ryan Thompson and Hunter Strickland carried the baton out of the bullpen and held Kansas City to two hits
column8: both in the eighth . Chris Mazza shut the door in the ninth . 	 “ It was just a really well - pitched game by Fleming and the rest of the relievers
column9: ” Rays manager Kevin Cash said . 	 Danny Duffy ( 2 - 1 ) struck out eight in six innings and allowed two runs — neither earned — and four hits with two walks . 	 “ Duffy was fantastic today
column10: " Royals manager Mike Matheny said . " He continues to impress us and made pitches all the way through . " 	 Kiermaier had two hits and two RBI from the nine - hole and combined with seven - hitter Joey Wendle and eight - hitter Willy Adames for five of Tampa Bay 's seven hits . 	 “ Kiermaier came up big for us
column11: ” Cash said . “ ( Kiermaier ) does a lot of things on a nightly basis to help us win and his bat is going to get going maybe today was the start of it . ” 	 Duffy held to Rays to only one baserunner until the fifth
column12: when Wendle singled with two outs . Wendle scored from first on an error by first baseman Carlos Santana on a high infield popup
column13: which highlighted a two - run inning . 	 “ I know that ’s one Carlos would tell you he should ’ve had
column14: ” Matheny said . 	 Kiermaier added an RBI single in the ninth . 	 Kansas City threatened in the eighth with two on and one out with Whit Merrifield at the plate
column15: but he struck out to end the rally . Jorge Soler drove in the Royals ' run in the ninth with a sacrifice fly . 	 DUFFMAN DOMINANCE 	 Duffy notched his 1
column16: 000th career strikeout in the fourth inning and passed Tom Gordon for sixth in club history . 	 “ It ’s something I knew I was approaching
column17: " Duffy said . “ When it happened and my boys congratulated me it meant a lot . I ’m thankful to be here as long as I have . ” 	 The longtime Royal has spent 11 seasons in the majors
column18: all in Kansas City
column19: one of three pitchers to do so . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Rays : RHP Chris Archer ( right lateral forearm tightness ) is eligible to return off the 10 - day injured list on April 21st but did not make the trip to Kansas City . 	 Royals : SS Adalberto Mondesi ( strained right oblique ) remains on the 10 - day injury list . The 25 - year - old has yet to suit up for the Royals this season . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rich Hill ( 1 - 0
column20: 7.53 ) will pitch for Tampa Bay on Tuesday . Hill will be the sixth consecutive southpaw starter that the Royals will face — the longest stretch in franchise history . Right - hander Brad Keller ( 1 - 1

column1: SEATTLE -- — Dylan Moore was n't supposed to be at third base Monday night until Ty France 's injury forced some shuffling of Seattle 's infield . 	 The Mariners were fortunate Moore was there for one of the crucial moments of their 4 - 3 win over the Los Angeles Dodgers . 	 Moore thwarted a Dodgers rally with a terrific defensive play to end the seventh inning on a night the Mariners used a couple long balls off Dodgers starter Dustin May
column2: a strong start by Justus Sheffield and a solid bullpen effort to come out on top in a matchup of early season division leaders . 	 “ He has a knack for making plays
column3: ” Seattle manager Scott Servais said . “ He ’s super athletic . You see the diving plays
column4: and he finishes plays . A lot of guys dive and knock it down but the ball kicks out of their glove . Does n't happen so much with Dylan . ” 	 Seattle handed the Dodgers a second straight loss
column5: the first time on the young season Los Angeles dropped consecutive games . Rookie Taylor Trammell homered and added a key RBI double
column6: but it was Moore 's catch and the performance of Seattle 's bullpen that was on the Mariners ' minds afterward . 	 Seattle 's four relievers combined for 3 1/3 scoreless innings with one hits
column7: two walks and one hit batter . 	 “ It goes to show what our bullpen is
column8: how much talent we have down there
column9: ” Sheffield said . “ When they get ahead it ’s just tough on the hitter . ” 	 When France was lifted
column10: Sam Haggerty initially jogged to third base . But Servais quickly swapped Haggerty and Moore
column11: who had been at second . It proved to be the right decision . 	 The Dodgers threatened in the seventh with two runners on and one out
column12: but Kendall Graveman struck out Justin Turner and Moore made a leaping catch at third base to rob Will Smith of a base hit that would have tied it . 	 “ The Will Smith liner ... it could have been a different game
column13: " Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said . 	 Los Angeles threatened again in the ninth against closer Rafael Montero after a walk and Mookie Betts getting hit put the tying run at second with one out . Corey Seager grounded into a game - ending double play
column14: and Montero recorded his third save . 	 Roberts said Betts — who was hit on the right forearm — would have some tests on his arm and was unsure his availability for Tuesday . 	 José Marmolejos got Seattle started with a two - run shot in the first inning that barely cleared the wall in right field . Trammell
column15: one of Seattle ’s top young prospects
column16: added a solo homer to deep left - center in the second inning
column17: and his RBI double with two outs in the fourth capitalized on an error by second baseman Chris Taylor for a 4 - 2 lead . 	 Sheffield ( 1 - 1 ) threw 5 2/3 innings
column18: allowing four hits
column19: three walks and striking out six . His lone mistake was Seager ’s two - run homer to center field in the third inning . Zach McKinstry added an RBI single in the sixth that ended Sheffield ’s night . 	 May ( 1 - 1 ) struck out eight
column20: but the two long balls were the first homers he ’s allowed this season . 	 “ It was a tough feeling for me . I guess I failed the team today . The hitters hit well . It was kind of poor execution on my end
column21: ” May said . 	 FRANCE LEAVES 	 France was replaced after getting hit on the right forearm by a 98 mph fastball from May in the fifth inning . France initially stayed in the game but was removed before the start of the sixth inning . X - rays were negative . 	 TRAINER ’S ROOM 	 Dodgers : OF Cody Bellinger is traveling with the Dodgers and ramping up his baseball activity . Roberts said Bellinger ( calf ) did some light jogging
column22: fielding and took some swings before Monday ’s game . “ Today was a good
column23: considerable day . Hopefully he comes out of today feeling good and we just continue to progress
column24: ” Roberts said . 	 Mariners : Seattle expects AL Rookie of the Year Kyle Lewis to make his season debut Tuesday . Lewis has been out for nearly a month due to a bone bruise in his knee suffered late in spring training . Servais said Lewis played in an alternate site game Monday and appears set to be brought off the injured list . ... Servais said the team has arranged a vaccination clinic for players and staff following Tuesday ’s game . The Mariners are off on Wednesday before opening a series in Boston on Thursday . Servais said as of now he does n’t believe the Mariners will get to the 85 % vaccination rate among Tier 1 personnel that would lift some COVID-19 restrictions teams must currently follow . 	 UP NEXT 	 Dodgers : LHP Julio Urías ( 2 - 0 ) looks to remain perfect on the young season . Urías gave up a season - high four earned runs in his last start against Colorado . column1: CLEVELAND -- — Carlos Rodón was far from perfect
column2: and that was perfectly fine with him . 	 Rodón followed up his no - hitter — and near perfect game — last week against Cleveland by hanging on for five innings and José Abreu homered twice
column3: leading the Chicago White Sox to an 8 - 5 victory on Tuesday night . 	 Rodón ( 3 - 0 )
column4: pitching in short sleeves despite temperatures dropping into the 30s and snow on the way
column6: giving up a homer and throwing 110 pitches — four fewer than in his gem on April 14 . 	 “ Definitely a grind
column7: ” Rodón said . “ They made it hard . I was just trying to eat as many innings as I could . You could tell they were battling on every pitch . ” 	 The left - hander gave up two runs and three hits . Rodón joined Eddie Cicotte ( 1917 ) as the only pitchers in club history to face the same team in his next start after throwing a no - hitter . He was the first to do it since the Angels ' Jered Weaver in 2012 . 	 Abreu hit solo homers in the fourth ( a 458 - footer ) and seventh innings . Manager Tony La Russa said he might keep “ the big fella ” in the DH slot on Tuesday . 	 “ I 'm superstitious and I want to DH him
column8: ” La Russa said . “ We 'll see what he says . ” 	 Tim Anderson connected for a two - run homer off Zach Plesac ( 1 - 3 ) and Yasmani Grandal 's two - run shot in the seventh put the White Sox ahead 7 - 2 . 	 Jordan Luplow homered for the Indians
column9: who scored twice in the ninth and stranded 13 . Luplow also set an early tone against Rodón by drawing a nine - pitch walk to start the game . 	 The Indians made Rodón work harder
column10: but still did n't do enough to beat him . 	 They had him in trouble in the fourth
column11: loading the bases with none out on an error
column12: catcher ’s interference and walk . 	 Rodón struck out two
column13: and could have been in bigger trouble when César Hernández ripped an RBI single . But Josh Naylor
column15: got thrown out at the plate when he ran through third - base coach Mike Sarbaugh ’s stop sign . 	 “ We had some big spots
column16: ” Luplow said . " We need to pick each other up . But we battled . We drew walks when we could . It was tough conditions . I think we ’re on the brink . I think we ’re close . Hopefully the flood gates open here soon . ” 	 Rodón lost his bid for a perfect game last week when he hit Indians catcher Roberto Pérez on the foot with one out in the ninth . 	 However
column17: he finished up the 20th no - hitter in club history and solidified his place with the Sox after undergoing Tommy John surgery in 2019
column18: pitching poorly last season and not being tendered a contract before re - signing . 	 On Tuesday night
column19: he walked two in the first
column20: one in the second and extended his string of no - hit innings against the Indians to 11 before Luplow led off the third with his fifth homer . 	 “ He 's showing a lot of guts in the way he competes
column21: ” La Russa said of Rodón . 	 Abreu 's rocket shot to left — it landed four rows from the top of the bleachers — put the White Sox ahead 3 - 1 in the fourth . 	 EATON SUSPENDED 	 During the game
column22: MLB announced that White Sox outfielder Adam Eaton has been suspended one game for triggering a benches - clearing incident against the Indians last week — the day after Rodón 's no - no . 	 Eaton thought Indians shortstop Andrés Giménez pushed him off the bag on a force out in the first inning . He shoved Giménez
column23: setting off some more pushing . 	 Hernández and Indians first baseman Jake Bauers were fined undisclosed amounts . 	 FIRST TIME 	 A day after making his pitching debut in Boston
column24: White Sox catcher Yermín Mercedes made his first career start at first base . 	 Mercedes dropped a throw for an error in the fourth
column25: and was replaced in the fifth . He fouled a ball off his left foot in his the second . 	 SOX MOVE 	 Before the game
column26: the White Sox purchased right - hander Alex McRae 's contract from their alternate training facility and optioned right - hander Zack Burdi . 	 The 28 - year - old McRae made two relief appearances with the White Sox in 2020 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 White Sox : La Russa said an MRI taken on RHP Lance Lynn showed no damage and he expects the 33 - year - old to pitch once his stint on the injured list ends . Lynn was placed on the 10 - day IL with a strained right trapezius on Sunday . “ All signs are good going forward with him
column27: ” La Russa said . 	 UP NEXT 	 The weather forecast does n't look promising
column28: but the Indians will start RHP Aaron Civale ( 3 - 0

column2: Calif. -- — Matt Olson hit a grand slam
column3: Mitch Moreland homered twice to back Sean Manaea 's shutout and the Athletics slugged past the depleted Minnesota Twins 7 - 0 Tuesday in the first game of a doubleheader for Oakland 's ninth straight victory . 	 Moreland connected for a two - run homer in the second inning and a solo drive in the fourth off Matt Shoemaker ( 1 - 1 ) . 	 The left - handed Manaea ( 2 - 1 ) allowed six hits
column4: struck out seven and walked one over seven innings
column5: throwing 95 pitches for his second career complete game and shutout — he no - hit the Red Sox at home on April 21
column6: 2018 . 	 Olson made it 7 - 0 with his fourth - inning slam through a blustery wind . 	 The A 's matched the longest winning streak in the majors this year with Boston
column7: which won nine in a row from April 5 - 14 . Oakland is 10 - 1 since starting the season 0 - 6 . 	 Minnesota finally got back on the field following three postponements because of COVID-19 protocols . 	 The Twins ' scheduled series opener in Oakland was delayed
